review.title: great location for shopping
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. restaurant and bar has excellent food &great service
review.negativeRemarks: bath shower need better grip , and or grab handle
review.locationRemarks: shopping union square & fisherman's wharf

review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, great stay. Would stay here again.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: First time stay.  Very small room.  Just fine for overnight business travel.

review.title: Nice hotel, Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The check in was unfortunate, but apart from that we had a good experience here.  I had booked two rooms and they lost one of the reservations.  I was able to show them my confirmation and they found us a second room.  Unfortunately the rooms were several floors away from each other.  But the rooms were pleasant, the staff was friendly and the location was quite convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: As they messed up our reservation, I'd say data organization.
review.locationRemarks: It's two blocks from Union Square and in the middle of downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Perfect location!!
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights and it was overall a great location and would definitely stay here on our next visit to San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Front desk was extremely helpful and friendly!

review.title: Beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the staff, great bar, and the room was beautiful. However when u book with Expedia your breakfast is not free and in the room the curtains were set up in a way that we could not close them and too much light came into our room at night. Other then that we enjoyed our stay and I would stay there again.
Very good location near Union Square and nice hotel. The rooms are very nice (a bit small though- especially the bathroom).
Great hotel! Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and convenient location.

I chose this hotel because it was close to the Theater San Francisco Playhouse. The staff was very friendly and helpful, provided me with information I needed. I had breakfast and dinner in Aveline and the food was great. I normally do not eat  in Hotel dining. No reason, I am usually out & about.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was clean food was good.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location! Close to many attractions and restaurants!

review.title: Room was nice, location was good, staff was poor
review.reviewText: Nice room, but staff wasn't the best. Gave us a difficult time during check-in, left dirty cups and used cosmetics bottles in our room from previous guest. For the price, I expected better service.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was spacious and well designed. Location was pretty good too, so long as you don't walk south. There's a bad neighborhood just a few blocks away.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk staff could have been nicer and more helpful. It felt like we had to argue anytime we asked for anything.
review.locationRemarks: Good shopping and restaurants nearby. Lots of other hotels too. But stay away from the Tenderloin neighborhood a few blocks to the south.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText:
We have just returned from a fantastic holiday staying at The Warwick. 
The location is great, two blocks from Union Square and very close to some great local bars and restaurants. 
The room was nice; well furnished and decorated, a lovely comfy bed and a bright, sunny room. We had a top floor room and there was very little noise from the street. The bathroom was clean and had a decent sized shower. 
We had a couple of small problems but the brilliant staff at reception made sure they were sorted straight away. 
The hotel bar was also very nice with friendly staff and not as sterile as some. 
I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: This is very nice reasonably priced, considering the market, hotel.

review.title: A perfect place to stay near Union Square
review.reviewText: Everything exceeded my expectations the staff the food the rooms the convenience of location all of it the Warwick is my new home away from home

review.title: Comfort and Ease
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square. Easy to get to public transport and move around San Fran. Hotel staff were fantastic. One of the best hotel restaurants around.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: A good hotel in a great location and walking distance to everything you need and especially the hop on/off buses. Hotel is fairly old but very comfortable.

review.title: Very nice location
review.reviewText: Close to union square for shopping, and across the street, tripadvisor's best diner for breakfast

review.title: Nice location.  Ran into terrible staff.
review.reviewText: Staff at front desk was terrible. Did not know fifference between twin and full beds.  Was not helpful.  Did not respond to requests to clean room.
Need's updating. Room was very simple with basically a bed and that was it. Outdated.

review.title: Beautiful
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff. Beautiful rooms. Very quaint. Bar is fabulous. Close to everything.

review.title: Beautiful
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and friendly staff. Hotel lobby bar is great too.

review.title: Really nice and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Vey polite and helpful. They help us from the chekin to check out.

review.title: The Warwick - nice older hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with great location.  Hotel only offers Queen beds.
review.negativeRemarks: King beds needed.  Plus the tub caulk is black and gives the impression of being moldy.  Price is high compared to Hilton and Marriott.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near Union Square plus theaters.

review.reviewText:
We will definitely be back....
Wonderful food, beautiful decor.....Great spot!

review.title: In town for work
review.reviewText: I arrived on the weekend and was greeted by a great staff.  Even though my room wasn't available they were welcoming and squared me away quickly. I lucked out that my room (queen) was over booked and I was given a small suite very accomodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect for my business needs.  Room well apointed.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall upgrade, hotel is a little tatty for a Warwick. Elevators were wobbly with a bad odor.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a major touris area which gives you a central location from which to navigate San Francisco. Very convenient to restuarants and shops.

review.title: Perfect hotel for our weekend visit.
review.reviewText: Great location. Excellent staff. Everything we needed and none of the extras we wouldn't use or want to pay for.  A perfect fit.

review.title: Quaint
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and cute. Our room was right next to the elevator so we could hear the elevator going up and down all night. Other then that great location, lots of things in walking distance.

review.title: Centre of the San Francisco action
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located to anything you could want for a visit to San Francisco. Close to transport, major shops, restaurants and the famous cable cars. We had four adults in our room - it was a bit small - but had a good sized wardrobe where we could hang coats and put bags - so not too bad.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was small and intimate. All of the staff were warm, friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Close to restaurants, Union Square, public transport, cable cars, large department stores - all at your doorstep.

review.title: Good Location - Great Value
review.reviewText:
Close to everything one would want to do in San Francisco.  Hotel has good restaurant and bar onsite.  Both very good.  Transportation no problem; cabs, limos, and Bart is an easy walk.

Good value - It's not the St Francis - but very close at 1/3 the price.  

Stay there, you won't be disappointed.  You will actually be very pleased.
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby is dark
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco - there is everything!

review.title: very close to Union Square
review.reviewText: comfortable and clean. Beautiful room & bathroom, marbled and luxurious
review.positiveRemarks: right near Union Square and the theater district
review.negativeRemarks: elevator shimmied a lot; hot water wasn't amazingly hot

review.reviewText: Overall stay was good, the staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was small but clean. The neighborhood is not the best (right near the tenderloin district) although it's only 2 blocks from Union Square. I would recommend this hotel if your looking for a nice hotel at a reasonable price!
Close to Union Square, easy relaxed atmosphere, would recommend. Safe place.
review.negativeRemarks: Only strange thing was the basin in the main room instead of bathroom but no biggy.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square , restaurants and 24hr convenience stores.

review.title: Smell
review.reviewText: The room was lovely, so was every staff member & the location is just perfect! However, the  smell in the room we had was so strong and yuck , close to unbearable.The staff said it was a musty old smell but we feel maybe the deodoriser they use in the hotel reacts with it or there's something wrong with the plumbing/sewage. Being such a small hotel, they could't give us another room so unfortunately,  we had to put up with it.It's not the kind of smell you get used to...  If it wasn't for the smell, we would absolutely recommend staying there.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff, great location, lots of character, nice rooms
review.negativeRemarks: get rid of the smell somehow
review.locationRemarks: Close to the train (super easy to get to the airport) , close to great shopping, restaurants, clubs & bars.

review.title: Great stay.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel at great location. Excellent staff. Clean room and great restaurant on site.

review.title: Centrally located at the edge of Union Square.
review.reviewText: Staff were exceptionally pleasant and service oriented.  Building is old, rooms tiny, and elevator slow.  Nonetheless, it was comfortable and the price was right.
Friendly staff.  Nice location...delicious Mexican restaurant a few buildings down.
Great place to stay, within walking distance to Union Square.  Friendly hotel staff!

review.title: Great location, unpleasant stay
review.reviewText: We were disappointed to have paid more for a suite only to be told by the manager that she has no idea how we weren't given the room we paid in advance for. She unapologetically gave us an smaller ADA room close to street level and the elevator, leading to both external and internal noise. The room was dusty and tub/sinks were clogged. The rest of the staff was kind and pleasant ad location was great. But after having stayed at Warwick NYC, Chicago, and Seattle, SF was disappointing.

photos.caption: Thin Windows equals lots of noise!

review.title: Nice hotel, if you get decent sized room!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with lots of character, however the room we stayed in (suite) was very small, and you couldn't swing a cat in the bathroom! Shared by 3 people. Expedia states you get free refreshments and snacks with the suite and this was not the case. Also parking at the hotel is higher than Expedia advertises! $58 plus 25% tax per day!!! Rip off. the windows are paper thin (not double/triple glazed so you can hear all the noises from the busy city outside. Room was not ready for 3 guests on check in, 1 bathrobe, 1 pair of slippers and 2 towels. Overall very disappointed with the amount paid for the room.

review.title: Helpful staff, good location, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText:
We booked a suite with a separate living room and bedroom.  There were two full bathrooms.  The sofa and bed were very comfortable.  There were two TVs in the suite.  The bed and sofa were so comfortable, it was easy to fall asleep.  The staff was helpful in providing recommendations for restaurants and directions on how to get around town.  Our room was cleaned daily and nicely freshened up.  The decor was also modern.  The overall hotel has a nice look inside and out.  

I felt very safe at this hotel.  The staff at the front door was alert as to who was entering the hotel and very friendly.  The elevators were running quickly and I didn't have to wait long at all.  This hotel has A/C, a rare feature of hotels in down town.  

The lobby has newspapers and a water dispenser.  Bring your water bottle and fill-up for your day of sight-seeing.
review.positiveRemarks: The furniture was so comfortable to sleep.  The location was good and walking distance to the big chain stores and some restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: Refrigerators could be bigger.  Sound proof the windows to reduce the noise from the garbage pick-up.  A small dresser to store socks, T-shirts, PJ's.
review.locationRemarks: 2 Blocks from Union Square.  Alohg a bus route.  The major train/bus artery is a walkable 5 blocks aware and near the mall and other stores.

review.reviewText: Great union square location, staff was friendly and helpful. Would definetely stay again.
Terrific hotel, great staff, wonderful rooms!  Absolutely recommend.
extremely friendly and helpful staff, nice and elegant and modern atmosphere
review.positiveRemarks: great location close to San Francisco's must see attractions
review.negativeRemarks: better soundproof windows needed

review.title: Classy hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: We stayed four night at the Warwick and it was very comfortable.  Even though our room faced the street and was on the second floor, it was amazingly quiet for the most part.  A couple of times our sleep was interrupted by some obnoxious driver continually honking his horn.  I would definitely choose this hotel again for another stay in San Fran... It has so much more charm and character than the huge high-rise big-name hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: It's small but very classy.  I love the ornate details everywhere and our room was very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: There were no extra blankets or pillows.  The pillows were too fluffy for me.  There were 3 of us in the room, but we were only given 2 sets of towels
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is very centrally located and convenient to the Bart and Muni.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff, very accomodating to our needs. Parking not very easy or cheap so advise not to bring car into the city.

review.title: Nice and close to Union Square and cable cars.
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service! Everyone at the hotel we're friendly and helpful.
Perfect little hotel. Friendly, helpful staff that gave wonderful recommendations from dinner to where to see the sunset. Would definitely return and recommend.

review.title: Very Charming!
review.reviewText: Lovely smaller, updated hotel with plenty of charm.  Furnishings are modern but are in keeping with the period of the hotel's construction.  Lots of soothing, blue and grey tones.  Beds are comfortable, and rooms are VERY well lit (loved that).  Balcony suites are quite spacious and had double balconies overlooking Geary.  Staff were very friendly.  Nice location just a short walk to the heart of Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: upon arrival to room towels had strands of hair on them, 1 bath towel and 1 hand towel.....ick!  That's a housekeeping detail.

review.reviewText: Excellent experience, lovely hotel and well located too!

review.title: Great location and stay
review.reviewText:
Easy to access to everything.
Clean, simple room
Friendly, accommodating staff

review.title: Lovely hotel, great location.
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a few nights on our honeymoon. Great hotel and in the heart of union square.

review.title: Good location in an aging queen
review.reviewText: The Warwick San Francisco was a great package deal for a Union Square area hotel in Expedia.  The location is a block away from the core, but was still very convenient to restaurants and public transit.  The staff was excellent and friendly at all times.  The room we had was small, but comfortable.  It was clean, very clean.  They could improve the TV service since it does not have any high definition stations available - hard to believe in San Francisco, but then again, you don't really go there to watch TV.
review.negativeRemarks: TV service
review.locationRemarks: Go to Katana Ya for ramen one night and have breakfast at the Pinecrest Diner one morning.

review.title: Awesome hotel is awesome
review.reviewText: My visit here was wonderful. The staff were great. The room was clean and I had a nice view of the street. It was located between tenderloin and Union Square  next to all the action . I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I like to the staff were very friendly and that the hotel is located near Union Square. It was a great launching pad for my weekend trip.
review.negativeRemarks: They didn't have any gym facilities but other than that everything was great.
review.locationRemarks: There shopping and eating nearby which really is the only thing I wanted to do so it worked out great.

review.title: very nice DT hotel
review.reviewText:
rooms very clean and newly decorated.    but small.    no chair to sit on.  no desk.    bench below the window to sit.  but we used for luggage.      small cup of americana coffee in the restaurant was over 4 dollars in the morning.  
be aware....parking at the hotel is over 50 dollars a night.    crazy....
review.positiveRemarks: locaton was nice.   close to union square.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms not good for working.     parking is crazy high.    would be nice to have free coffee in the lobby
review.locationRemarks: there is a rental car location about a block away.   better to rent as needed vs paying the parking.

review.title: Hotel is in good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel for the price but really small rooms. The elevator was really old and shaky. Staff was really friendly though and they had a nice bar inside with awesome drinks/staff.

review.title: Nice hotel good location near Union Square
review.reviewText: Disappointed with the size of the room. No room for luggage, even the vanity sink did not fit in the bathroom.

review.title: Nice Hotel but average location
review.reviewText: Very nice, accommodating hotel staff and excellent food at restaurant.  Room was very comfortable and quiet.  All typical amenities which was great.  Area outside of hotel was a bit rough with lots of individuals hanging out asking for handouts.  Streets were very littered.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy walking distance to cable cars and Chinatown.  Reasonable rates and excellent food at hotel and in bar as well as around the neighorhood.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel bar staff was only average.  Small bar area but couldn't seem to get regular, attentive service from server.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, Chinatown.  Dave's Deli was ok but service was slow and food was cold.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: I was disappointed. I suppose it would have been considered luxurious in the 20s, but I expected more modern comfort for the price.

review.title: Decent quality
review.reviewText:
Nice arrival experience and service from recreation. Room was on the side street which was perfect as it was nice and quiet on the 6th floor. Mini bar was used on first day however not replenished (or now realised not charged for since returning home) which is something they should check on. Only complaint would be the housekeeping standards, skirting boards dusty and crumbs in a number of places from a previous guest. I understand a couple if they've missed a spot but I doubt the room was vacuumed before my arrival. 

Free wifi is available and a premium version is available for a charge. I used the free which was a woeful service, a basic webpage like google or emails were hard to access, was not confident to pay for a faster speed. May need to look at increasing your complimentary speed? 

Drinks in the bar were nice. 

Restaurant was... Ok menu far too complicated and a little pretentious for the style of hotel. I think it may be turning people away with quite a few single travellers stopping to check the menu then deciding to go elsewhere. On the night I dined only two other tables of one.

review.title: Excellent staff. Great food and drink
review.reviewText: This hotel had a lovely feel about it. It was welcoming and each and every staff member we encountered were friendly and nice. It was a short walk to union square and a short can ride to Fishermans wharf. Happy hour at the bar was great with really nice cocktails and snacks and the food in the restaurant was beautiful.

review.title: Updated hotel best Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean, friendly staff. Close to shops, restaurants, and bars

review.title: Really nice stay
review.reviewText: Room small, but that is the norm is SF.  Stayed 4 days and each day appreciated the staff and room more.
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable and room was quiet.  Restaurant was really convenient and tasty.

review.title: good hotel close to action
review.reviewText: good price, great location, beautiful hotel, nice staff, nice soap products in the shower :-)
review.locationRemarks: shopping, 20 minute walk to the water, less than 5 minute walk to Union Square, 15-20 minute walk to Trader Joe's

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: All depends where you we stay. Good hotel in the center. The rooms are a bit small and noisy from the street. Better to take a higher floor room if possible.
review.negativeRemarks: Better windows against the noise outside?
review.locationRemarks: City center... So a lot of things!

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText:
I stayed with my wife, for my aniversary. The room was excelent, the only bad thing I found was that the air conditioner was very noisy.

Over all very good.

review.title: Nice place but strange sounds going on at night.
review.reviewText:
from 3-5am we heard something that sounded like people dragging furniture around for like 2 hours on the floor above.
kind of strange considering all the rooms have carpet and not hard wood floors.
also, a bit noisy when trying to to take a daytime nap, but if you want to be anywhere in the city it probably has the same problem.
review.positiveRemarks: i got a big suite for a good price!

review.reviewText: If you're happy to be in that part of SF, and its convenient for me, then on a price-value scale its fine. No in-house gym is a drag. Staff are great, though.

review.title: Dismissive GM + 3rd Party Parking Garage
review.reviewText:
First off, Alana (front desk girl) was very professional & accommodating. She was the most helpful out of the 3 staffed that morning. Bill (the GM) & Don (front desk) were both very dismissive about resolving an issue we had w/ our car. 
Don assisted us w/ our bags & we noticed damage. We brought it to his attention & he said to talk to a manager as he walked away. We were pretty dumbfounded to the response. We went to the lobby, mentioned the situation to Alana. She called Bill. He said that they are not responsible for any cars, that the parking garage they utilize valet for their guests are solely responsible; that there are 3 main garages all hotels in SF use & no hotel owns a parking property. He pointed to the fine print on the ticket which stated no one is responsible - c'mon...
I said there was nothing mentioned on Expedia saying they use a 3rd party garage, it is not common knowledge for guests to know this information, & one would assume that the hotel takes care of their guests.
He then calls the parking manager. He arrives & tries to hustle hard by being abrasive & rude, saying that he sees no damage & even if we file a claim we won't win.
I asked Alana if it was possible to just comp 1 night of parking, which she more than agreed was fair, then Bill authorized somewhat hesitantly.
We also left some items in the trunk, we noticed ended up missing after taking inventory.

My background is 13+ yrs in customer service in tourism, food/bev, retail & management.
review.positiveRemarks: Alana, the front desk girl. She was more than willing to help in a time where we needed assistance & everyone else walked away.
review.negativeRemarks: Mention the hotel uses an untrustworthy, reckless 3rd party parking facility for valet & no one is responsible though we are entrusting the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Location is central to shopping, eating, night-on-the-town, sight seeing.

review.title: Fine boutique hotel - very friendly staff - quiet
review.reviewText: I asked for a room facing the back on an upper floor - no view, but super quiet.  Room was good size and bed was super comfy.  Staff was very friendly.
Hidden treasure with super comfy beds. Close to Union square, perfect for a quick escape!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel.  Exactly what I was expecting.  Rooms are not big but we just sleep there.  Quiet. Friendly.  Clean.  It's all good
Was looking for old  but renovated hotel near center of town.  The location is great, the restaurant was so good for breakfast.  Everyone was helpful and friendly.  Hope we can stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Renovation was perfect--they kept the character and updated beautifully.

review.title: Good value and convenient location by Union Square
review.reviewText: This is a comfortable small hotel two blocks from Union Square.  There is a nice staff and great little bar.  Rooms are small but well-appointed.  This is an excellent value given surrounding hotels.  The Clift is right across the street, so one can enjoy drinks in their beautiful Redwood Room without staying there.
review.negativeRemarks: The doorman/valet service was a bit cumbersome.  There wasn't anyone waiting at the door, but they did eventually go take our car.

review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, location good (few blocks from Union Square), room a little small. Found a dirty sock by the bed that wasn't ours, but overall would stay there again.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel... But...
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great. The room was small, but fine for our time in San Francisco. The room; but for a hair ball and a peanut on the floor was was clean (we didn't like to see this though). The bed was nice and firm and the sheets were very clean. The bathroom was clean and the shower was okay, there was consistent warm water, not very hot water though. I do like a hot shower, not a very warm one... The hotel staff was nice and helpful. But, and here comes the big, but and I hate to write this, but even more than not wanting to write this, I didn't want to experience this.... The room smelled bad! I hate, hate, hate, hate a smelly room. It smelled like a hotel room where lots of people had been staying in it for a long time.  I have no idea how you prevent this, but other hotels do prevent this, but I am sorry to say, The Warwick does not. or at least not the particular room I stayed in. No, I didn't ask for another room, no I did not make a big stink (pun intended), what were they going to do, move me into another smelly room... So, we were there for two nights and the room was fine, but smelled bad and that is the worst to me. So, to The Warwick, I say, "Thanks for having us, it was pretty good, but the smell of the room ruined it for me. Please do what you can to get rid of the smelly rooms and I will gladly come back and love your hotel.  Thanks!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Cool rooms. Reasonably priced room rate and parking.
review.negativeRemarks: Make the rooms not smell and make the water in the shower hotter!
review.locationRemarks: Great location, in the heart of Union Square near everything!

review.title: Nice hotel downtown
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay here. There was a slight wait for my room and valet, but the the hotel staff made me feel like my stay there was important to them and took care of me because of the extra wait time.

review.title: Staff was excellent....room just so so
review.reviewText:
The staff were very friendly and helpful, exactly what you want when staying in a hotel.  Unfortunatley the hotel itself was not exactly as wonderful.  When we arrived we went up to our room but as soon as the elevator door opened the strong smell of cigarette smoke in the hallway greeted us.  My daughter is pregnant and this was not good for her.  Once in the room the smell was not there, however the room had a musty stale smell.  The staff we were told was working on the cigarette smell.  When we left and came back it was gone.  We left again for dinner and shopping returned and the smell was there again.  I think the hotel needs to have a check in place for guests smoking in the hallways. 
The hotel had been recently renovated however it was not done very professionally.  The rate was good through Expedia but I would not stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: Smells.
review.locationRemarks: On the edge so sketchy neighborhood.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Check in was ok, front desk staff was helpful. Room was definitely disappointing. Small, kind of tacky, but the location was good for getting around town. Front desk staff handled the storm and power outage very well. They were "comforting" and well prepared with light sticks etc.  I'm sure there's better places to stay around the same price ($200.00) per night so would I stay there again ? I doubt it.

Booked Warwick after my favorite hotels were already sold out. The hotel has a boutiquey feel which we like. Staff were great, very friendly and accommodating. Our room was great, spacious for San Francisco. The bed was comfy, small but queen is the biggest size they have. Overall a great stay.

review.title: Standout hotel!
review.reviewText: A combination of attractive rooms, attentive staff and fabulous food made this hotel a perfect choice.
review.locationRemarks: Amazing location.

review.reviewText: friendly staff  great accommodations centrally located clean great stay

review.title: Great location and value
review.reviewText: The staff was so attentive, and the hotel was nearly perfect.  It is a small boutique hotel in the middle of it all.  My only complaint is that NO rooms are king size beds.  They are all queen.  We are just use to a larger bed.  The room decor was really nice and over all it was a great stay.

review.title: Great hotel, in a good location.
review.reviewText: Great hotel and very friendly staff. Loved the European bar, great cocktails. My Queen room was hmmmm. . . compact, but served its purpose well. Clean and safe. . . cute decor. I didn't eat in the restaurant, but it looked good. For breakfast head next door to the diner next door called David's. Strong coffee and filling omelettes.  All the hotel staff really helpful, keen to make your stay enjoyable. Good location, short walk to Union Sq and down to the Ferry Building. Watch yourself in and around Tenderloin (especially if you take Taylor St to Market) it is a bit gritty during the day and I wouldn't venture there at night. As a hotel and a base in SFO I really liked the Warwick and will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Clean but Small
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean but the rooms were small.

review.title: Centrally located hotel....
review.reviewText: Ask for a corner room or suite .  The doubles are very small and be aware there are no king beds !

review.title: great location, near union square
review.reviewText: Nice, small and well kept hotel. Lovely staff. I like the small cafe and the cool bar too.

review.title: Great place in the hub of Union Square
review.reviewText:
The hotel is recently renovated in a very comfortable and charming manner. It serves as a great respite from the myriad of activities immediately out the front door. The front desk is friendly, with all of the staff casually but elegantly dressed. I stay at a lot of hotels all over the country and internationally and have not felt so welcomed, in a genuine fashion, in a long time. 

The room was very clean, modern but not "cold", and had a great space with high ceilings and a balcony overlooking the nightlife below. Wonderful, all the way around!
review.positiveRemarks: The very comfortable feeling and incredibly friendly and genuine staff. All in a great location.
review.locationRemarks: Theatre district out the door, cable car line and Union Square a block away, many great restaurants and night spots as well as music clubs.

review.title: Awful experience
review.reviewText: For our first trip to SF for a conference, my colleagues and I booked a suite with two queen beds for 3 occupants at this 3.5-4 star hotel through Expedia. Upon arrival, the front desk staff was very pleasant with their greetings and sending us to our room. After hulling our luggages through the musty smelling hallway to the top floor to our room, we discovered that we were downgraded to a 1 queen bed room without notification. Front desk then explained that due to full occupancy, they had to move guests around. We then ended up in a standard 2 double bed room and 3 "free drinks" tickets. Our bathroom also had a musty/ toilet smell which was not pleasant at all. After a non-restful stay due to all the mix-ups, we left the hotel on foot and realized that the physical location of this place is at the border of the "Tenderloin" area which has a high number of street occupants. There was also no on-site gym. We switched to the Westin as a result for the remainder of our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were all very pleasant.

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent, room was great. This is a small hotel with more of a boutique type of feel. I was very happy with it. It was in a nice area as well.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the Moscone Center for a convention I was at

review.reviewText: Looked for a place centrally located to the City, at a reasonable price.  This far exceeded expectation.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the professionalism of the hotel staff, and the bar.  Both were top notch.
review.locationRemarks: The location is a little loud, but understandable, since close to the heart of the city.

review.title: EXcellent Stay
review.reviewText: We were really nervous picking a place somewhere we knew nothing about but I couldn't have asked for better. The staff was amazing and always more than helpful. Our room was taken care of everyday. It was very enjoyable and very clean
review.positiveRemarks: The location couldn't have been better and with the staff to help you get around easily and quickly I loved that.
review.negativeRemarks: They should offer room service. After walking those hills I didn't want to get back up for dinner some nights :)
review.locationRemarks: Union square,, all kinds of shopping and the street cars as well as the hop on and off buses where right there.

review.reviewText: The room that my girlfriend and I stayed in was very clean and well kept. The furniture and decor was modern, the bed comfortable and the ambiance fantastic. The staff there were polite, cheerful and accommodating to our needs and questions. The area in which it is located, Geary and Taylor Streets, is right in the hustle bustle of union square with shopping and dining galore. It was easy to leave the hotel door and be instantly drawn to the activities and doings outside. Highly suggested is the nearby Biscuits and Blues underground live blues club and restaurant; the food and music there were both great. It is located just east of the Warwick, three doors down Geary St. Overall I would definitely recommend the Warwick Hotel if you're staying in Union Square (West).

review.title: Very pleasantly surprised!
review.reviewText:
We had stayed in various hotels in the Union Square area of San Francisco on previous visits.  We decided to try
a hotel that we had not stayed at before.  The welcome we received was so pleasant and professional.  We felt 
comfortable right away.  Our room (I am a " room snob") was great.  The bed, bedding, lighting, etc. exceeded our
expectations.  There was not one thing we could find fault with...wonderful towels, linens and pillows.  So far, this
has been our favorite!  The staff was so gracious and friendly...we were always greeted with smiles and conversation.
We decided that this will be our first choice for subsequent visits to San Francisco.  
For us, we will always take the path of the smaller, boutique hotel, where service and comfort are quietly provided.
Kudos  for The Warwick.
review.positiveRemarks: Just about everything you could think of.
review.negativeRemarks: Would like to have access to a "business center" for computer and printer access.
review.locationRemarks:
You are close to just about anything you would want to see in San Francisco.  If not, they will tell you how to get
there!

review.title: Great hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating.   The original room we had was on the second floor with a view of a wall and the room was noisy.  It was also my birthday whilst we were there so my husband asked nicely for a different room and they put us on the top floor with a view of everything!  The rooms were clean and nicely furnished and spacious.  The staff were very friendly and wished me a happy birthday and left me a card as well.  Even housekeeping left a thank you note for the tip we left.
review.positiveRemarks: The very friendly and caring staff and the location... Close to everything you needed.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the furniture and cabinets seemed to require repair and the elevator seemed old.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks away from union square , close to Macy's , saks fifth ave and a few shops down from Starbucks and a great breakfast place across the street

review.title: Good location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: They don't have the business center yet, but the staff were helpful and friendly so we still git checked in okay and had printed boarding pass. The two nights stay went well, and the room was comfy. The only thing I'd like to suggest is they should maybe have two chairs in the room...my husband and I couldn't snack at the same time at the table due to there's only one chair in the room and we didn't feel like sitting on the bed eating is a good idea.

review.title: great location and very helpful and friendly staff
review.reviewText:
the hotel has been refurbished and appeared almost new. our car was directed to park immediately outside while we unloaded our bags and easy-to-understand instructions were given re parking. Reception was a delight and a bit like staff thought we were VIP's!
The location is superb, near shops, restaurants and drinking holes. When asked for directions to a restaurant to meet friends, a map was produced a route drawn and we were informed that we did not need the car as it was less than 15 minute walk and safe too.
Rooms are like new and the bed a delight!
We have been touring for several weeks and I think The Warwick experience was the best. There were several really good hotels but the staff here lifted the experience to the top of our list.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing - keep the staff's enthusiasm up!
review.locationRemarks: see above

review.reviewText: very nice hotel recently remodeled in the center of town

review.title: Great staff, newly remodeled
review.reviewText:
This hotel just finished remodeling so everything looks modern and fresh. The bar and restaurant were very convenient and comfortable. Our room was a little small, but was spotless, safe, and met all of our needs. The location was great with easy access to everything around Union Square (including Morton's Steakhouse).

Last but not least, the most outstanding thing about this hotel was the staff. From the greeting that we received the minute we pulled-up in front of the hotel, to the folks that checked us in (Linda), to the nice woman that helped me print my Giants tickets just before the game. A big "well done" to the entire staff.

I would be happy to stay at the Warwick in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The new renovations, and mostly the friendly people that work at the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wi-Fi. Hi-Def TV channels. Cheaper parking.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to great restaurants, theatres / plays, shopping, Giants Baseball.

review.title: Great staff, newly remodeled
review.reviewText:
This hotel just finished remodeling so everything looks modern and fresh. The bar and restaurant were very convenient and comfortable. Our room was a little small, but was spotless, safe, and met all of our needs. The location was great with easy access to everything around Union Square (including Morton's Steakhouse).

Last but not least, the most outstanding thing about this hotel was the staff. From the greeting that we received the minute we pulled-up in front of the hotel, to the folks that checked us in (Linda), to the nice woman that helped me print my Giants tickets just before the game. A big "well done" to the entire staff.

I would be happy to stay at the Warwick in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The new renovations, and mostly the friendly people that work at the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Free Wi-Fi. Hi-Def TV channels. Cheaper parking.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to great restaurants, theatres / plays, shopping, Giants Baseball.

review.title: Perfect San Francisco hotel in ideal location.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is classy & comfortable. Friendly & informed staff. Good restaurant & bar.
Was excellently cared for as well as provided with the privacy & facilities I needed to work & rest.

review.title: Hotel with Personality
review.reviewText:
Despite the fact the hotel was being renovated, I did enjoy the hotel personality with a European kind-of style. Location is great and staff is helpful at anytime ;)

After the renovation I do believe it will be even a better place to stay and discover San Francisco city.
review.negativeRemarks: it's unfair at this time talking about improvements since the hotel is under renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Central and close to major streets. 10 minutes walking to BART subway.

review.title: Nice but under renovation
review.reviewText: One night stay because we were touring USF. Disappointed over the fact of no food service
review.negativeRemarks: Once the renovation os done would be a wonderful place to stay
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and restaurants galore. Close to USF the reason we were there.

review.title: Nice hotel in excellent union square location
review.reviewText: Very close to union square main area. Nice hotel. Recently renovated room!!!!! Parking is just the issue which is $42 overnight per day. But after looking around. Everywhere else was about the same or even more money!! Overall excellent experience

review.title: I would not return
review.reviewText:
Disturbing from the moment we arrived :(
Was gross.
Photos online were deceiving.

review.title: Hotel Under Total Remodeling
review.reviewText: When I booked my stay, I was not informed that the entire hotel is under a remodel. I would immediately have looked elsewhere had I been told. The entire main floor has papered over windows, a very charming flop house look. The entrance has a desk and a desk clerk ONLY. Not even a bellman when I checked in. I changed rooms and it was satisfactory, only because my wife was not with me. However, the floor above me was under total construction from 8am to 5 pm 7 days per week. Just fine if you are deaf-I am not. As I attempted to exit the building the second day , the facade was being power washed with water. I managed to have my second shower for the am with dirty water this time. I expect a full refund from Expedia. There were at least 12 other pleasant and nicer hotels within a block which were of a similar price where I would have been happier. I believe I am due a 100% refund from Expedia promptly.
review.negativeRemarks: everything

review.title: Below Avg. unimpressive
review.reviewText:
The lobby was being renovated so the desk area was moved, so you dont get that cool view you get from the web site. What you do get when you walk in is a dark, dusty make shift lobby that smells like dry wall dust. All for $165 a night. This for a date weekend on Valentine's weekend, Thank you, Warrick
The room was supposed to be vintage, but it was old and worn out. The couch was so worn it sagged in the middle kind of like my grandmas. The room was in disrepair, sink faucet leaked, and tub wouldn't drain, the worn carpet had lots of stains. The bed looked really cool but the mattress was springy and worn. The front desk help was kind, it is a great location and hopefully they renovate the entire place. We didn't even ask for another room because it was Valentine's weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: Place needs maintenance.

review.title: Perfect for a business trip.
review.reviewText: I stayed two nights for a conference nearby. The room was more than spacious, comfortable for relaxing, sleeping and working, and the two (!) bathrooms were clean and had good counter space. (The shower had great water pressure, one of life's little luxuries.) The location was perfect, with easy access to many restaurants, museums, shopping and the BART station. The staff was friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: It was lovely to stay in a less corporate, less sterile environment. The rooms were nicely appointed and soothing.
review.negativeRemarks: There was construction going on in the lobby, which was obviously only a temporary inconvenience.

review.title: Not bad at all for solo travlers
review.reviewText: The hotel's location is great, very close to everything downtown. The staff were very helpful too.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel is very old, it can use some renovations.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: An old, awful, smelly hotel
review.negativeRemarks: A wrecking ball would fix it

review.title: Nice hotel, very good location
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and knowledgable staff. Great location, walking distance to major shops, restaurants, china town, fishermans warf etc

review.title: The nicest staff! Great location.
review.reviewText: I will stay here again. The staff was so helpful and friendly. Great location. Excellent bed.

review.title: Not happy
review.reviewText: I payed for a room with two queen beds and when we got there the lady told us they only have a room with one bed but the couch opens up. The hotel is outdated and in shady area .

review.title: Nice, central and a very European charm to it.
review.reviewText: Loved the decor in the romos, perfectly located hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is way to expensive, had to park a few blocks away for half the Price.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Market Street with all the good shopping, next to Unin square and all the high end shops. Easy to catch the cable cars, metro.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: They allowed my friend to check in before I arrived by confirming with me via phone call; much appreciated. Our room was surprisingly quiet for downtown, probably because we were on the Taylor side and not the Geary side. Can't really complain too much since I got a screaming good deal off of Expedia, but the rooms could certainly use updating if not outright renovation. Overall a good stay. Location is just 'fringe' enough to be close to Union Square but not too close (right on the edge) of the Tenderloin. Staff was really nice and helpful. Aggressive homeless in SF a much worse and more dangerous situation than I remembered from a few years ago but fortunately we were able to have dinner and after-drinks while walking around the Union Square area without incident.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the bedding was clean and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Run-down facility; room needed new carpeting and a shower head that would stay in place; water pooled in the tub while showering.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks west of Union Square, on the edge (but not quite in) the Tenderloin. Walgreens across the street is convenient.

review.title: Nice European hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: It was advertised as having a fitness center and it does not. Also, there is no breakfast due to dining room renovations.

review.title: Great location under renovation.
review.reviewText: The Hotel is easy to get to from the BART station. Check in was a breeze and they were able to accommodate my request for a high floor. They did put an almost $90.00 authorization on my card which I am patiently waiting 5 business days for. The elevators were a bit shaky but you have to remember the hotel was built 100 years ago. The lobby and hallways seemed to be kept very clean which helps appreciate the history of the building. We stayed in a deluxe queen room which seemed to be a fair size for two people in San Francisco. Besides the old sushi we found in the mini-fridge from a previous guest, the room was spotless. The furniture was old and was in need of some updating. The armoire could use some love as the doors needed to be slammed to stay closed. We were woken up by a neighbor and their family that kept slamming the doors in their room for about half an hour straight one morning. Can't blame them as the doors need to be closed to get from one side of the room to the other. The queen bed needs to be replaced. The springs poke through, the mattress sags and has uneven support. You don't exactly feel rested when you wake up. Going along with the history of the hotel is the plumbing. The pipes seemed to cry and moan when someone used their shower or sink. If you have never stayed in a busy city before, be ready for late night sirens and pointless arguments in the street. We were on a high floor, but we can imagine how loud it gets on a lower floor.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel lobby and rooms are kept very clean. double windows to help block the city noise.
review.negativeRemarks: The furniture needs major upgrades. Bed springs are worn out and poke through the bed. Closets and drawers need to be slammed so they stay closed.
review.locationRemarks: Just blocks from Union Square with plenty of places to eat in every direction. Short walk to public transportation stations including the BART.

review.title: Nice Stay
review.reviewText: Spending four days in San Fran and picked this hotel for price and reviews. It is convenient to everything near Union Square. I imagine we got this nice price as they are under renovations to their bar and restaurant and wasn't aware of this and is shut down until June of 2014.. You basically get your own coffee in the reception area as there is nothing available in the rooms and that is where you get your ice also so that is a hassle. The rooms are warm and clean with bathrooms being decent but everything is dated. The staff is super friendly and helpful for all questions we had.
review.positiveRemarks: The convenience of l0cation and being clean.

review.title: Thanksgiving Weekend in San Fran
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff is wonderful, very polite, and always smiling. However, Ben, gives suggestions for restaurants, we found that every restaurant that he suggested, was horrible. Sears Fine Foods, is way over priced, and they pack you in like sardines. The "famous" Swedish pancakes are AWFUL, and then you pay extra to have berries with them. NOT worth your time or effort for this one!! The Pinecrest Diner is great. Went there for breakfast and the food was great, and worth the price. I ordered oatmeal, and have never received such a large bowl, that was fantastic.
The restroom in our room "708" has black mold in it. We brought it to their attention, they tried to paint over it, instead of cleaning it up. The mold is behind the door, and also behind the toilet. This was NOT a good experience for people who have never been there. The overall look of the room was nice, but the mattress could use some updating. The bed is made with flat sheets instead of a fitted and flat sheet. This does not work well when you are not a great sleeper. Who wants to end up sleeping on a hotel mattress in the middle of the night, certainly not us!
The refrigerator in the room is VERY small, and if you want to use it, I suggest having maintenance take all things away from the "honor bar" so that you can use it. Make sure that you let the front desk know, so you do not get charges from the honor bar...
All in all, it was an "ok" experience, however, we would choose to stay elsewhere next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Mold issues in the bathroom, and removing all things from the refrigerator so the patrons can use it. New mattresses would be a great improvement!!
review.locationRemarks: The location is full of homeless people begging for cigarettes, beer, and money. This was not a pleasant experience. Stay closer to Union Square!!

review.title: The bed sucked!
review.reviewText: The bed sucked. The room was very small and not laid out properly.

review.title: Friendly Service Makes Up for It
review.reviewText:
My boyfriend and I decided to travel to San Francisco as part of my 21st birthday celebration. The location of the hotel was very convenient. It was two blocks from the Hyde & Powell cable car and another two blocks to the BART station near Market. The next street over was a Walgreen good for midnight runs and two blocks to Union Square.

When we checked in we were given a free upgrade to a suite because of my birthday & the receptionist, Claire was super friendly and helpful. Another receptionist was also helpful one time in referring us where to go to get somethings when Walgreen nearby was close but I don't remember her name.

When we were given the keys to our room I was a bit surprised that it was an actual big key rather than the cards I was so used to from other hotels. Our room was on the seventh floor right near the elevator so it was convenient. The door was quiet heavy in my opinion and when we opened the door and walked it I couldn't help but be super sensitive to the odor. It had an old antique odor but I got used to it. A few thing I have to complain about the room was one of the dresser, the door would only open by force and hence when you closed it it made a noise and took force too. The TV was ancient, the old small fat ones. The sofa was old. The only thing that looked nice was the bed & frame and the bathroom. The room servicers were nice in cleaning our rooms after our first night (we stayed for two). The noise was not that bad so overall it was good
review.positiveRemarks: The service provided by the hotel staff was amazing. Friendly & Helpful receptionist and understanding room service providers.
review.negativeRemarks: Its time to change that dresser/closet, television, and sofa. Ancient antique style is good but some of these items don't work and smell!
review.locationRemarks: Time square and cable car is two blocks nearby when you exit the building and head to the left. Wallgreen across the street to the right.

review.title: renovating ...
review.reviewText:
had booked a two room suite ... on arrival told there was confusion and due to renovations not available .. .but would be given one of the "new" rooms ..
after a long flight I was "confused" and accepted...
once in the room .. which was only a basic queen room I then complained ..
Nothing was able to be done but after some discussions they then agreed to refund one night .. this was still unacceptable to me but since it was raining outside and I knew SF was "busy" had no option ..

Had booked the two rooms since we were staying 5 nights and wanted to spread out ... in the room I had our traveling bags had to be stacked away behind a closet due to space ...

btw .. the bathroom sink and mirror was in the walk in area ... bathroom not big enough

review.title: Vintage abode
review.reviewText:
The Warwick is located right across from the main theatres on Geary Street, so the location is excellent. The hotel itself is charming. Rooms are kind of small but this IS an older hotel and so rooms tend to be smaller. Still, we had, in addition to the bed, two nightstands, an armoire, a good sized desk and chair and a lounge chair in the room space. The only drawback was that the armoire doors couldn't open completely because the bottom of the bed got in the way. I wouldnt recommend that a family try to share the room but it was fine for a couple.

The bathroom housed the bath/shower and toilet, but the vanity was actually just inside the entrance to the room, which was kind of weird but I have seen that in other older hotels where they cannot squeeze everything into the bathroom.
Staff was ultra helpful. The restaurant adjacent to the lobby was convenient for breakfast.
Well worth it. I would stay again.
review.locationRemarks: theatres, restaurants and shopping nearby. cable car a couple of blocks away. perfect downtown location.

review.reviewText: We booked online a suite. But when we arrived there was renovation going on and the room booked was right above this work. We instead were given a tired old room on the very top floor. Disconcerting! Bed good, shower terrible. Lovely city, good hotel staff. Hotel has good position near to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Whole place needs upgrade and this has started
review.locationRemarks: See above, near Hop on Hop off bus stop and great restaurants.

review.title: Victorian Charmer
review.reviewText: A nice, small hotel with a traditional city vibe. They were remodeling the dining facilities so we missed out on the restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee pot in room rather than by request, more comfortable stairways rather than "fire escapes" that felt less than safe,
review.locationRemarks: Near theaters

review.title: Charming hotel in the heart of downtown
review.reviewText: I had a lovely stay in hotel Warwick. While the decor is not modern it is very charming and quaint. The staff was always very helpful and friendly. I was worried there would be too much noise off the street but it was fine during the night. Hotel is right where all the action is being very close to union square and other tourist attractions.

review.title: Older hotel, a little tired but nice.
review.reviewText: Older & a little tired but everything was in good shape. Staff was excellent and very accommodating. Parking was extra expensive ($42.00) so I parked in another garage nearby. Great location.
review.positiveRemarks: It was comfortable and relatively quiet given the location on a busy corner.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower parking rate. Replace worn items (frayed carpets, etc.)
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square with good restaurants, theater, and shopping.

review.title: Warwick Hotel
review.reviewText: Very Good location Fantastic & helpful staff, nice property
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union Square Shopping & great restrauants
review.negativeRemarks: King Bed was too narrow
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks form Union Square, Great Wine bar Enos down block

review.title: Wonderful
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, organized. Loved the location. The staff was really nice even when I lost my key.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great staff and location right next to Union Square. This is a vintage hotel which I was not aware of. Very antique feeling and smell throughout
review.negativeRemarks: update and remodel

review.title: They don't make them this great anymore!
review.reviewText:
I was in SF briefly, and I am so glad I chose the Warwick! Located close to Union Sq I was able to walk wherever I needed to, and had everything right at my fingertips. They brought me a great breakfast after a long flight and late check-in, it was just the boost I needed for a full day walking around the city.

What I didn't expect was to leave my entire bag of jewelry that I brought out for a wedding, on the bathroom counter as I quickly packed to check out. I didn't realize until days later when I was onsite for the wedding and called them in a panic. The front desk checked with housekeeping and connected me with Victoria. Victoria was a delight and assured me right away. I cannot express the sense of relief I felt, and the honesty and integrity of the staff at this hotel should be noted. You really can't ask for a better staff, when they stand above what most people would do in the same circumstance. Victoria called me the following day to give me the tracking number, and they all went above and beyond. Well done!

review.title: Room
review.reviewText: Room was so small you would hardly walk around the bed. The carpeting should have been replaced 10 years ago. The furniture was so beat up it looked like it was from someone's basement. They should have removed some of the furniture so it would not have been so cramped. There was a desk, two chairs, two nightstands and an wardrobe with a queen bed and the room could not have been 400 square feet. It was really a joke. My husband would not even go to the room until it was time to go to sleep it was so horrible.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Very nice experience. Short stay. Staff was great.
review.positiveRemarks: The style and furnishings. Bed was very comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: carpet
review.locationRemarks: location was excellent...located in the heart of downtown. very convenient!

review.title: Good location hotel needs an upgrade
review.reviewText:
This is a nice hotel but it needs an upgrade
That said, the staff was very good and the room was very clean
The location is great too-- near just about everything
review.negativeRemarks: Decor
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is in the theatre district right near Union Square

review.title: Warwick is a hidden gem!
review.reviewText: I was traveling to San Francisco on business and needed a hotel close to Union Square. I booked the Warwick and was pleasantly surprised. It's only 2 blocks from Union Square and close to all the sites as well as the Cable Cars on Powell Street. The staff were so helpful with directions, suggestions and an early check-in! The bar/ restaurant is cozy and the food fast and tasty. The room was spacious and clean and well appointed. The only thing that was a negative is that they charge for WiFi. It's such an annoyance in this day and age. Otherwise, I'll be back!
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge for WiFi, that's pretty lame.

review.title: Good location, close to Union Square
A first class hotel
review.reviewText: The Warwick is a first class hotel to stay at when visiting a first class city such as San Francisco. The staff was friendly and extremely professional. The rooms are comfortable with a classic touch of elegance.

review.title: Good hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Stayed with wider family for 3 nights, using 3 suites. Rooms were comfortable, but noisy as the windows are single glazed and we were on the second floor in a busy/thriving city centre. Location was great and staff very friendly/helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Better noise insulation
review.locationRemarks: It's right in the centre of SF with museums, art galleries, shopping, trams, restaurants etc all nearby.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square, clean room, attentive staff. The rooms are tiny and with a small, oldish TV. Its pretty loud at night due to its location and in it very very hot at night, with only a ceiling fan. It does have AC, but it never worked.
review.negativeRemarks: the AC, make the windows sound proof.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square with every shop and lots of restaurants and theaters.

review.title: Very well located.
review.reviewText: Very dirty hotel. SHeets had holes and were not changed at all. I had to complain.
review.negativeRemarks: It MUST be cleaned properly, sheets had holes and were not changed.

review.title: Stay was nice.
review.reviewText: Stayed there on a Thursday with a few friends. We're from the suburbs and we just wanted to experience the city for the night for one of my friend's bachelor's party. It was nice.

review.title: San Fransico with my sister
review.reviewText: The hotel was great the staff of very friendly and more than happy to help us in any way they could. Great location and great rooms.

review.title: Needs serious updating.
review.reviewText: Broken cabinets, no ice, restaurant expensive and closes early. Update!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly. Complimentary car service to financial district.
review.negativeRemarks: I understand its a 100 year old hotel. i stay in plenty of those - renovate. Add modern amenities. Expand food offerings. Wireless is expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great location - close to everything.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is very good, an easy walk to Union square. Good amenities. Although there was a renovation on the floor where we were staying, that didn't cause any problems. The staff is very helpful.

review.title: Convenient location for shopping and transporting
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenient for shopping at Union Square and for public transportation. The hotel is not a ultra-modern slick hotel. Rather, it is older, which gives it a San Francisco charm. Adding to this are the small rooms, small dining room, and small lobby, all contributing to a small and intimate experience. However, this does not diminish its comfort, convenience or charm.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience and traditional San Francisco charm.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast was standard, common, and adequate. No complaints, but if you wish to improve, this would be one possibility.
review.locationRemarks: 1) shopping at Union Square; 2) Curran theatre is across the street; 3) access to BART and all other transportation is quite near.

review.title: Perfect!
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly located in the middle if downtown with easy access to the muni station. Everything was close by! We bought the 3 day muni pass and rode the busses and cable cars everywhere. Everything was about a 20 min ride from the hotel. The breakfast they had was great too. The rooms were clean and very beautiful as well.
review.negativeRemarks: The street noise was a bit loud but nothing that prevented us from resting at night.

review.title: Highly Recommended!
review.reviewText:
Our experience at this hotel was great. The staff is really friendly, the hotel is very clean and the ambiance is fantastic. I was travelling with my best friend but I would highly recommend this hotel for couples. The rooms look very romantic and old fashioned.
There was always a friendly and helpful staff member at the front desk willing to go beyond your expectations to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable.
The location of the hotel is great too. It is walking distance to the BART, the cable cars and Union Square. There are many restaurants around (I recommend the Cheesecake Factory) and right next to a Walgreens (trust me, this is very useful if you need to pick something up last minute or in an emergency!).
I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!
review.positiveRemarks: Service of the staff and location
review.negativeRemarks: You have to pay way too much to get WIFI
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Next to many major transportation routes and right in the middle of downtown

review.title: quaint hotel near Union Square.
review.reviewText: Everything was quite nice. room was small but nicely decorated.

review.title: Great hotel for sight-seeing
review.reviewText: Small room, but very centrally located. Staff was helpful. Can walk to the cable car, which was ideal. The decor was ancient-looking which is typical of the warwick series of hotels. The shower was incredibly bad - seemed like you can either get very high pressure or no pressure at all. The closet (although antique) was literally eaten away in many places. But we were only in the hotel to crash for the night, so it didn't matter to us.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower

review.title: Quite disappointed
review.reviewText: Came with fair expection provided with the rate it's charging. Was quite disappointed at the condition of the room - quite old and there was creaky sounds when opening closet doors. Condition of bathroom was fair. Convenient location though as close by everything - shopping areas, buses, cable car.
review.negativeRemarks: Condition of the hotel is poorer than the photos posted.
review.locationRemarks: Location is close by shopping areas, cable car and buses. Pretty convenient.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: Front desk stuff was excellent. I would stay here again.

review.title: Very pleasant place to stay
review.reviewText: The room is small but comfortable and very clean. The young staff is topflight - welcoming, responsive, eager to help. The location is convenient to everything I needed to do. And the price was satisfactory. I would certainly recommend the place.
review.positiveRemarks: Courteous helpful staff. Good location. Good price. Clean and efficient place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: ACT. Shopping at Union Square. Short walk to the cultural center - symphony, opera, Asian art museum. Many - too many - good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Highly Recommended! I'll be back!
review.reviewText: I was very surprised and pleased by how nice it was, and within walking distance to so many points of interest. I truly scored a deal using Expedia! The furnishings, from the beautiful lace curtains to the marble counter and bathroom finishing, provided a very elegant and luxurious experience. The staff were all extremely helpful and the on-site restaurant served delicious food and and expresso. I would love to stay there again on my next trip to SF.
review.positiveRemarks: The beautiful and elegant furnishings, the cleanliness, the ceiling fan, the locatiion!!! And the friendly staff!
review.locationRemarks: The location is so close to parks, shopping, museums, Chinatown and much more - you can see so much just walking around.

review.title: Great Hotel in Downtown S.F
review.reviewText: I liked the Staff and their service to help us have a great stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet getting old in our room.
review.locationRemarks: Good. Easy to get around city.

review.title: Great hotel for the family and centrally located.
review.reviewText: Small, intimate botique style hotel with a 1890's theme. Rooms were small but clean and adequate. Room service was very good and prompt. Small lobby but the staff were very helpful with directions and arranging cab service. Main bar and dining room were very nice and "homely". We enjoyed our stay there and would return again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff service, location, dining services and food
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were a little too small.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, centrally located in downtown Frisco

review.title: Nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: My room was on the third floor next to the elevators. That was not a problem since they created no noise I could hear in the room. However, being on the third floor made the room somewhat dark as we faced onto an alley on the north side of the building in February. The room was also small and somewhat cramped. I did not mind since I was staying only one night. The furnishings were nice antiques and the bed was great. Terrific location to visit the theater, art galleries and Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit cramped and dark
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location

review.title: Period charm and a perfect location --
review.reviewText: We'll be back to the Warwick soon and often. This is a lovely classic hotel, a century old but thoroughly modern and furnished in antiques and period charm. The desk staff was very friendly, checked us in quickly and was always helpful. Our room was a delight -- bright and sunny (top floor, corner#, extremely comfortable bed, all-marble bath with a great walk-in shower. The location is perfect, amid the theaters near Union Square, very near a wide variety of restaurants #one in the hotel too) and shopping and even a blues club on the block. Transportation is literally at the door -- the hotel is right on the major cross-town bus line and a very short walk to the Powell cable cars and street cars on Market and BART. This is the city -- expect panhandlers and mobs of tourists and city prices, and if you're a light sleeper bring ear plugs against the street noise -- the cops were busy on Saturday night! If you have to have huge, stay at the Hyatt. For charm, the Warwick is the place.
review.positiveRemarks: Super-comfortable bed, charming decor, friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: Weak coffee on the room service breakfast tray -- no, really!
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for restaurants, shopping, theaters -- public transportation is a breeze.

review.title: Be careful
review.reviewText: Property looks tired, not as good as the pictures. No partking or valet service. No lunch in the restaurant although they will send you room service. Smell of Marijuana wafting through the halls

review.title: Best hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
beautiful hotel, fanastic
why do you want me to write so much
I was happy and that should be enough

review.title: Old Hotel in need of Improvements
review.reviewText: The hotel has the unique charm of an older hotel, but the charm quickly wears off. The beds need to be replaced, you can feel the springs from the mattress in your back. The shower heads are good if you are very short, but anyone 5'8" and above will have to duck down quite a bit. The wall paper on every wall is extremely beat up and chair for the desk had stains all over it. I would recommend spending the extra money to get a different hotel.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Went to this hotel on a Sunday with my girlfriend. The place had a restaurant at the lobby floor, nothing much fancy. The place is a bit dated, but that's not a surprise. Had a room in the corner. My girlfriend was impressed with the shampoo and soaps, and the room was in good condition, though dated. The problem was that it was a bit hard to close the windows and I didn't figure it out until the morning how to close all the blinds so we slept (or tried to) with the lights from the outside coming through the window. Other than that the staff was real nice and they let us keep our bags there after we checked out so we could check out the city. Not a bad place, but not that great either.
review.negativeRemarks: the windows to the room
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square

review.title: Will be my home away from home in San Fran
review.reviewText: Great room loved the homey decor and the bed was heavenly!

review.title: Not Really Impressed
review.reviewText: Room very much in need of refurbishing. Old and very dimly lit and small. The hotel is very central to the centre of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Size and the lighting of the room.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Jr. suite nice for a couple
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the Victorian character of our room and sitting room, which the staff was kind enough to upgrade us to having. The room was on the quieter ally side instead of Geary St. and this was helpful. The bed was very comfortable. The carpet needs to be replaced, I hope, though, that they don't sacrifice the character of the place in the upcoming remodel.

review.title: great hotel, very friendly
review.reviewText: Excellent staff, very helpful and accommodating, and even though we late(over slept) checking out, they were understanding.

review.title: A little dated, but excellent location
review.reviewText: In terms of location, this is the place to be. You're just so close to Union Square it's awesome for the money. But the hotel needs to invest in itself a little more. The staff were great, but the room doesn't look like a single item has been replaced since the 1960s (except the TV). So if you're looking for somewhere average with a decent location for a good price - take it.

review.title: Warwick Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: Lovely old hotel, such a shame the upkeep is lacking. The staff are helpful but do not really seem not to care, just a job! The location is a plus.
review.positiveRemarks: It is in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: In need of some TLC. It is a shame as the old fashioned theme is rather lovely, just needs a bit of a clean, paint, recover chairs, new carpet etc.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square just along the road.

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText: It was very convenient for me since it's located so close to Biscuit & Blues & to catch the express bus to Candlestick Park. Pleasantly surprised as it was also close to Dottie's True Blue Cafe, my favorite breakfast spot, & to Blue Bottle Coffee Company.
review.locationRemarks: So close to places I wanted to go to. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: keep your car home
review.reviewText: Great hotel but don't bother driving your car there, expensive valet parking and pricy overnight parking at the nearby structure.
review.negativeRemarks: parking
review.locationRemarks: amazing downtown location but noisy for weekend nights. bars downstairs.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Helpfull staff.Walking distance to the BART ( subway).
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit tight.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Friendly staff but old and run down.
review.reviewText: Great location and friendly helpful staff. I got a free upgrade because the hotel was overbooked so the suites are very roomy. Decor is outdated and cleanliness was more of a problem with things being old and run down rather than not cleaned between guests. Good price but would not be my first choice for my next trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor and cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: 5 minute walk to union square.

review.title: 100 better places to stay
review.reviewText: very small rooms, no king beds, noisy, no AC, bad room service, horrible coffee, over 45 min wait for valet parking to bring us our car.. never again.
review.negativeRemarks: small rooms, no king bed, really slow and expensive valet parking, throw away the coffee,
review.locationRemarks: OK

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and clean. The only issue I had was the old windows. They had replacement windows that were too big and could not lock, allowing a draft and more important, noise into the room. I think I slept maybe 3 hours that night with all the outside noise.
review.positiveRemarks: the location was perfect and the staff was very helpful and couteous
review.negativeRemarks: noisy room
review.locationRemarks: great location, with everything you need within a few blocks

review.title: Excellent San Francisco experience
