review.reviewText: The Warwick is a quaint, lovely hotel, located right off of Union Square and super convenient to just about everything. The action on the street can get loud if you leave your windows open, but they are equipped with double sliding panes, should you opt to close out all of the noise. We stayed here during the Nike Women's Marathon, which generated a lot of activity and noise EARLY in the morning, but it was very convenient and when the windows were closed, it was not a nuisance. Very friendly staff and a great place to stay in the city!
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy if you leave the windows open at night
review.locationRemarks: VERY convenient to all of the Union Square happenings

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText:
I was at first nervous about staying at the Warwick because of some reviews I read by travelers that have stayed there. I was however very pleased with my stay. The room we stayed in was clean and certainly adequate size-wise for two people. I read that the rooms were small, but I suppose we got one of the bigger rooms. I was also geared-up for lots of street noise (as recorded in some reviews) and the possibility of not being able to sleep at nights because of the noise volume. Well, that was not the case whatsoever. We had a room facing Geary Street and it was very quiet after dark.

The hotel served the purpose of a place to sleep for the two nights we were in San Franciso. If you're looking for amenities (such as swimming pool, hot tub, etc.) this is not the place for you to stay. If you are looking for a decent night's rest and a central place to stay then I would recommend this hotel.

The hotel is conveniently located in Union Square. We were able to save money on snacks and breakfast by purchasing food items from the Walgreen store located across the street from the hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant - it was overpriced.

The hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant. I would stay at the Warwick again if the price is right.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: Really old dirty carpet. Incredibly small rooms, disgusting sofa bed and a tv out of the 70's. Continental breakfast was awful - next to no food, zero service and paid $10 ea for the privilege!
review.negativeRemarks: Size, decor, cleanliness.
review.locationRemarks: Ok if u like Union Square! I hated it - wish we'd stayed at Fsherman's Wharf

review.title: Needs a good cleaning and basic upkeep
review.reviewText: Quilt on bed was dirty and torn. Decorative pillows had stain on them. Carpet was filthy. Window in the bathroom had caked on dirt around it. Layer of dust on all furniture. Staff was helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty

review.title: Good for enjoying Union square
review.reviewText: Since it is old building, thick appearance and interior are good for those who likes old atmosphere. Valet parking requires 37 USD per day.

review.title: convenient, clean and friendly
review.reviewText: We had a very good experience at the Warwick, and will stay there again.

review.title: Pure San Francisco
review.reviewText: Terrific location and SO San Francisco! If you are going to see a show, stay here! Lots of terrific restaurants within a block or two! A bit noisy, but to be expected in a downtown area.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Great for theater and dining. Close to BART and Union Square. Walk to everything!!

review.title: Holes in the bedspread!!
review.reviewText: The best things about this hotel are the location and the kind staff. I found the room to be a turnoff because there were holes in the bedspread! I loved the historic feel of the hotel, but I also feel that history doesn't preclude cleanliness, especially for the price of the Warwick. Overall, it wasn't a bad stay, but I'm not sure if I would return.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Two theatres are across the street and the Millenium restaurant (amazing vegan place) is about two blocks away!
review.negativeRemarks: Holes in the bedspread.

review.title: Good but room to improve
review.reviewText: Location of the hotel is very closed to Chinatown and Union Square for sightseeing and shopping by walking distance. It is an old fashion style but quite comfortable. There is only 1 computer serve the guest is not enough and too slowly. Recommend to provide free WIFI at least in lobby for planning the travel plan.
review.negativeRemarks: No wifi
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Chinatown and union square

review.title: Not a quality hotel.
review.reviewText:
I was very disappointed.
I always thought the Warwick name meant quality but this one was not.
The restaurant was closed on Sunday night for dinner or drinks and I was told "it was Sunday". Other quality hotels are open for their guests whether it is Sunday or not.
I had to have the window open because it was warm in the room.
The people at the front desk were very courteous and helpful but it must be the hotel rules that have made these decisions.
I would never stay there again and will pass it on to my friends.
Very disappointed in the Warwick.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: even though it is small but well furnished and clean. Close to every thing
review.positiveRemarks: Close to every thing. Clean and excenlent customer services

review.title: Great holiday location
review.reviewText: Excellent location in the downtown area of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent hotel restaurant; friendly and helpful staff
review.negativeRemarks: Noisey
review.locationRemarks: Close to Powell and Market; easy walk to the Convention Center

review.title: Parking scam!
review.reviewText: The room was extremely small, nothing like the picture. It was decorated cute and was clean. Bed was ok. They stuck us with a bill of $45 for one overnight parking. They tried to add on another $17 (They claimed oversized vehicle) but we refused to pay. Rip OFF!!
review.negativeRemarks: Room too small & parking was ridiculous.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location ate dinner at Postrio

review.title: Great location, great staff, needs upgrade!
review.reviewText: Desperately needing updating! The room smelled musty. The plumbing is shot! The room faced Geary Street and was loud almost all night long. No A/C but descent ceiling fan. No coffee/hot water kettle was big disappointment. They have a loud refrigerator next to bed stocked with expensive goodies, why not upgrade room, especially dual pane windows instead! For same price could have stayed in nicer accommodations but all were booked when we did reservations. The staff was great and lovely. Just need to get hotel updated. Wonderful location in Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Great location. It's weird that they still use keys instead of cards. Room was bigger than what we expected.
review.negativeRemarks: using keys
review.locationRemarks: great - central

review.title: only stay if you're hearty
review.reviewText:
The noise from Geary is unbearable....its so loud we tried to leave the TV on all night to drown out the yelling and street music.

The bed was so uncomfortable I think I could tell you how many spring were in the mattress.

Great locale to Union Square and public transport to go to other SF neighborhoods for exploring.

review.title: Two Twin beds!!!
review.reviewText:
Pros: Good location on the corner Geary and Taylor streets. In the heart of union square, close to bars, shopping and restaurants.

Cons: TWO TWIN BEDS! Really? Who sleeps in twin beds?! I requested to have a queen but was told that it wasn't available by the guy at the front desk. I doubt he even tried to look. I'm not digging the old victorian decor either. For a 3 star hotel, they didn't even have separate hair conditioner.

With so many other hotels in the area and in the same price range, i would not stay here again.

review.title: A+ Service and Comfort
review.reviewText: Just a wonderfull expieriance. The staff was fantastic and more then eager to help. Our rook had 2 balconies that you could walk out on and overlook the picturesc SF life below. An older hotel that is just laced with wonderfull decor and details throughout. We loved our stay and will be back again for sure. Thank you!!
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff first of all. Very nice and just so willing to help with anything. Secondly the buildings features.
review.negativeRemarks: The bar was a little depressing but we didnt use it.
review.locationRemarks: Really close to shopping and resteraunts. Right in the middle so it was only a short hop anywhere we wanted to go.

review.title: Very good location and helpful staff
review.reviewText: The room was nice, reasonable for the price. As the hotel is facing the Geary street and my room was on the 2nd floor, the traffic noise was annoying during the night.

review.title: pretty darn nice
review.reviewText: Midweek stay for business, overall everything was really nice. They upgraded me to a suite, the price was very low for the value, and the furnishings and comfort were top notch. I did not pay the charge for Internet...it should be free, The cafe/bar was nice, the food good but not great and the wine list is decent. Convenient location close to most Union Square/Chinatown attractions.

review.title: a quiet gem
review.reviewText:
Stayed Tuesday and Wednesday nights while making a one-day presentation during a convention at the Moscone Center (about 5 blocks; downhill to M.C. -- uphill back!).

Clean, very well-appointed rooms, elegant furnishings, updated bathrooms, surprisingly quiet (we had a room along the back). Would stay there again for this conference.

Helpful staff. Typically overpriced restaurant in hotel; breakfast was very good.

Only negative: $14 charge for internet access; this shouldn't be an add-on at a hotel in the business/convention district.

review.title: Close to all Union Square Sites
review.reviewText: It's a pretty nice hotel. Not fancy, not a dump. Everything works in the room. The bed is alright. It's walking distance to the BART station at Powell street and the Cable Car stop. It would have been nice if there was a hair dryer in the room.

review.title: good time
review.reviewText: We have had a very good stay! Nice hotel good service, very nice lady who serves breakfast. Good location so overall we are very satisfied and would stay here again
review.locationRemarks: Little Italy, nice restaurants

review.title: A Comfortable Old Friend
review.reviewText: The Warwick does not do glitz. If you want glitz, go up the block. This is a very european style hotel with smaller rooms. It suits us just fine and we have been coming here for years. The staff is the best and the attention is personal. The restaurant is very good. The plumbing can be a bit noisy, but the amenities are good quality and they are constantly trying to give one towels,and cookies, and rides to the financial district. We like this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in the Union Square area which is central for theaters, galleries and shopping. It is very near chinatown and market street. Public trans is easily accessed from this area.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: Great hotel with great staff in a great location. Only 2 blocks to the main shopping centre in San Fran and walking to major attractions such as Alcatraz, Golden gate bridge and Fisherman's wharf. ( lots of hills though.) Cable car is located 2 blocks if walking isn't your thing. Overall a great city.
review.locationRemarks: Haight Ashby is a cool spot, down by the water of the bay is somewhere to head. For sports fans 49ers stadium is a 20 min bus ride and Giants stadium is 5 minutes bus ride from hotel.

review.title: Downtown
review.reviewText: Slightly worn elegance downtown. Very convenient, walking distance to restaurants and other downtown amenities. Very nice restaurant caddy-corner (we didn't try the restaurant in the hotel). Just steer clear of the tenderloin neighborhood (not too far away) at night.

review.title: Little gem
review.reviewText: Lovely, quiet room. Nice, comfortable bed.

review.title: Friendly staff, but thankful my whole party didn't show up- no room!
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly. Easy access to Union Square. I booked a non-smoking suite, however when I checked in, I was given a smoking suite. I had to open the windows to get "fresh" air and still had to wash everything I brought back even if it wasn't worn because of the smoke. I was in town for a marathon, so the smoke was no good! Also, the "second room" had a gross couch in it that pulled out into a bed. The couch had questionable stains, and I would not sit or put my things on it. Lucky that my husband stayed home with the kids on this venture.

review.title: never ever this hotel again
review.reviewText: it is very noisy, we could not sleep even till midnight, they should change double panel window. The front desk service is lousy, takes really long and service attitude is very arrogant. the only positive is the location. But it is good enough for one time experience with this hotel.

review.title: Mediocre
review.reviewText:
Overall, this hotel is fine, but it isn't great.

Pluses:
- Clean room
- Unique decor - if you like that Old Victorian, bed and breakfast feel

Minuses:
- Feels very outdated. They actually give you a physical key. Who uses physical keys anymore (vs. plastic cards)?
- NO AIR CONDITIONING
- Customer service was not superb
- Main lobby area does not feel particularly clean
- Not the best deal for the money - the hotel Adagio right next door is a lot better deal for your money

review.title: PRETTY GOOD HOTEL
review.reviewText: FRIENDLY STAFF. OVERALL ROOM WAS VERY GOOD EXCEPT FOR FOLD OUT BED. TEENAGERS WHO SLEPT ON IT WERE NOT IMPRESSED AND HAD TO PUT MATTRESS ON FLOOR AS THEY WERE SAGGING THROUGH THE SPRINGS. HOTEL IN GOOD POSITION IN UNION SQUARE. QUAINT RESTAURANT WITH FRIENDLY STAFF

review.title: to expensive
review.reviewText:
Good location and cleanliness but to expensive compare the service received.
Small room and no free coffee or tea unless you asked. No free wi-fi

review.title: comfortable gorgeous hotel
review.reviewText: nice location,cute and gorgeouseuropian room,secure place and best hospitality

review.title: boutique hotel NOT
review.reviewText: Room too small. Bed too small and uncomfortable. Too noisy. No in-room coffee. No ice. Unfriendly staff.

review.title: niner game
review.reviewText: Excellent experience

review.title: No air conditioning - very loud outside noises
review.reviewText: We were on our honeymoon and wanted a very nice hotel in downtown San Fransicso. When we got there, we realized there was no air conditioning and windows had to be opened. Outside street noises made it impossible to rest and get any sleep that night. While the room was stately and beautiful, overall comfort lacked due to the noise.

review.title: worked
review.reviewText: WWe were looking for a hotel in San Francisco that had a room with a pull out bed for my mom and another bed for my husband and I. When we arrived I asked if they had a crib for my 2 year old to sleep in and how much it would cost a night and they informed me it was free and delivered it to our room within 5 minutes of checking in. I was impressed. The rooms are old like most places in sf but we didn't spend much time in there and it was a great value for our needs. If you are looking for luxury this isn't your place but it is charming.

review.title: Old hotel - management company need to stop being so tight and renovate!!
review.reviewText: This booking was a bit of a shocker as most bookings I have made have been spot on with the feedback from others on Expedia. However, this one surprised me as I would in no way rate it as highly as others have. It is an old hotel in desperate need of renovation and new furnishings. I'm almost certain the sofa bed my sons slept on still had dust mites from 1973! Conflicting fading floral patterns on the walls, curtains and other soft furnishings are an eyesore (in the suite we got anyway). The front desk clerk was of no assistance in helping to get our bags out of the car as "his colleague was on a break" - dude, it was late at night, you're not gonna get a dozen people wanting attention at the front desk if you walk ten paces to help with a bag or two!! I also felt he was dismissive and discourteous regarding my questions on parking (it was valet or "I don't know anything about any other parking stations around here" - fair enough you want people to use your service, but you can lose the tone!!!). We had to cart our own bags up using the hotel trolley (4 large suitcases) and then found there were stairs going down to our room so we had to haul them in after a long and tiring plane trip). Some people may call this place "boutique" or quaint. I call it old and disappointing.

review.title: Served the purpose
review.reviewText: Nice old hotel, although could do with a dusting!!! Paint job in the room wouldn't hurt either. Staff were friendly and helpful. Excellent location!

review.title: Very nice boutique hotel at a reasonable price.
review.reviewText: Very happy with our choice! We will stay there again.

review.title: good deal
review.reviewText: A rough start- we checked in late and found that they only had a smoking room for us, even though we had booked a non smoking room. We suffered through the night and gladly the next morning were we're upgraded to a non smoking suite with a nice view. From that point on all was good. Location is central with much to do within walking distance. Frienly and helpful staff.

review.title: Stay at the Warwick and you won't be disappointed
review.reviewText:
We just returned home yesterday from our trip where we stayed at the Warwick Hotel. When intially booking a hotel, I was looking for: Very Reasonably Priced, Great Location for Walking to Sites, Safe, Nice enough that we wouldn't mind staying in the room, and Clean. Surprisingly, I found all these, and more while staying at the Warwick. I got a great deal on Expedia on the hotel. It is two blocks down from Union Square, two blocks down to Market Street. It is by shopping, art galleries, and theaters. It was fun leaving our hotel to walk to other desinations. It is four blocks to the BART, close to bus and cable car lines, and across the street from a Walgreens. There were places to eat around the hotel. The area around the hotel felt safe because there were lots of people out at night. When it got dark, however, there were homeless people going through garbage cans, even with all the other tourists there. The room was small, but functional, comfortable and attractive. You could hear other people talking sometimes, and turning on their water faucets; but it wasn't too disturbing. Everything was very clean.
I mentioned, when I made the reservation, that it was our anniversary. When we arrived, there were fresh chocolate dipped strawberries with a chocolate creme and a bottle of wine. I mentioned at the desk that we didn't drink and they bought and delivered to our room some Martinelli's by the time we next came back to our room. Nice touch. My vote for the warwick? Yes!

review.title: review
review.reviewText: Very good hotel and niche service for the price.

review.title: happy customer
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel location but the hotel room was very small and the walls were very thin. Normally we could hear when our neighbors got up in the morning and the pipes made a loud screeching noise in our room when they took showers. However, we didn't spend much time in the hotel room, and the location was very convenient.

review.title: Excellent Choice
review.reviewText:
It's hard to balance price with good accomodations but we stuck the perfect balance at The Warwick. This hotel was quiet and nicely updated. The surrounding restaurants provided a nice variety. It was a good location. We needed a 2nd bed for our kid, and at the Warwick the sofa bed came with a suite that we could close off, all for about the same price as single-bed hotel rooms.

The staff was friendly and very helpful. The only thing "wrong" was that wi-fi was extra, but the computer in the lobby was adequate to check email and the BART schedule. 2 thumbs up. We will come back.

review.title: Hotel was a lot of hype, but a disappointment.
review.reviewText: We were promised a non-smoking room. We were given a smoking room and they said they could not change it because all the non-smoking rooms were booked. HELLO - you mean like the one we booked!!? The street noise was horrendous. Sounded like Mardi Gras was in our room till 2:00 AM. They called our room a suite. Reality is that it was a typical SMALL hotel room divided by sliding doors. Do yourself a favor - don't stay here.

review.title: My choice in SanFrancisco!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff,had a womderful time.

review.title: Warwick, San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was a very pleasant experience.

review.title: Looking forward to next time!
review.reviewText: This was a perfect place to unwind, great staff

review.title: Nice Hotel and Experience
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, very small room, friendly staff, perfect location!
Walgreens across the street, Union Square within 2 blocks, restaurants, department stores, all within a block or two. Would return.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Overall the Hotel wasnt impressive, plus the side of downtown this hotel is located one wouldnt feel safe.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Like the service, the location, the facility, even the price. I'd go back, for sure

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice enough it was decorated to the period in which it was built. The location is in the center of the city so you have to be going to the theater or be prepared to drive or take a taxi to the tourist areas. Service was great rooms are small.

review.title: Not a great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was okay, but warm and neighborhood was not so great.

review.title: Very comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: We spent the final two days of our California vacation in San Francisco and were very happy with the accommodations and staff of the Warwick. Staff gladly helped us with information about returning the rental car a short distance from the hotel; scheduling a 3 1/2 hour city tour that picked us up at the hotel door; and arranging for an airport shuttle. Thank you Warwick for your hospitality!

review.title: A Great Gem
review.reviewText: I go to SF 3 to5 time a year on business, First time at the Warwick and I'm glad I found this gem. Great location, great staff, very nice room. All my trips to SF will be at the Warwick for now on.

review.title: Great alternative to big convention hotels
review.reviewText: The Warwick is located right in the middle of the Union Square hotels. There are a vast amount of options for restaurants, stores and entertainment within the immediate area. The room was not exactly roomy, but was very comfortable and clean. The price was a fraction of that paid by my colleagues who stayed at the convention hotels only one block away.

review.title: Great staff but very small room.
review.reviewText: Great hotel staff. Very small room.

review.title: Will take another hotel-bad restaurant
review.reviewText: Check in was great, room ok, but breakfast the next morning was horrible. Horrible hostess, rude and very, very unaccomadatng. Toast was so stale you could taste it. Sausage was greasy and restaurant had a bad odor about it. Night auditor (about 9:30 pm, Friday was rude but staff at check in which was about 6:00 pm on Friday was outstanding so we expected great things from the hotel. It used to be be one of our favorites and after a few years we wanted to revisit it, what a disappointment. Sadly disappointed. Will not return, too many good hotels to choose from from and sadly this one did not make the cut..

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: A very cramped lobby, and the entrance is smack on a busy sidewalk. The rug on the floor was dirty and worn out. No room refrigerator or coffee making facility, and not telephone book in room. Emergency calls from family members were refused by desk attendant who pretended not to recognize my name or even acknowledge the number of the room I was staying in. The reason for this strange conduct became clear when I was hit with a bill for over $87.00 for "long distance call." They must have charge at a rate of $10 per minute. The desk attendants were unhelpful to a couple who had to leave earlier because of illness and needed help with contacting the airport shuttle. They were told to keep on trying to contact the shuttle company themselves. However, house attendants did their job well .

review.title: cozy
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, not too big or too small. Great staff. Very comfortable.

review.title: Hotel was not bad at all.......
review.reviewText: This hotel was dated but comfortable. The rooms are small but didn't spend a whole lot of time there anyway so it was adequate. I found my stay to be reasonable. Service desk was available at all times and very helpful. If you want to shop, this is a good location to the shops, restrurants and local transportation. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. There are a few amendities that were not availble but it's nothing I couldn't live without.

review.title: On our list of place to revisit
review.reviewText:
We found the hotel staff very helpful. We arrived earlier than check in time we needed to drop our luggage at the hotel and return our rental vehicle before 11am, staff were very accomodating.
Best advise given to us was by hotel reception to purchase a Transit pass, for $26 we got our monies worth considering the charge of $5 each time you ride the cable car.
Hotel room was small due to large old fashioned furniture but it was fine for the amount of time we were actually in the hotel. We liked that the hand basin and vanity were outside of the main bathroom, ideal when 2 women are getting ready every day.
We were on the 7th floor so didn't hear much street noise. The room didn't have air conditioning it was very warm during our stay but the overhead fan and open window were adequate during the short time we were actually in the room.

review.title: Price was ok, but you get you pay for
review.reviewText:
They didn't have a non-smoking room as I had selected through Expedia. This would have been a show-stopper if we weren't so tired, and it was already 10 PM at night.

Our door locked was broken and it took about an hour to get us into the room. They didn't offer any compensation, or even a place to sit while they worked on the lock.

review.title: Not for non-smokers
review.reviewText: I booked a non-smoking room but they gave me a smoking room and couldn't do anything about it. It smelled horrible. I'll never go back.

review.title: A good Hotel close to the trams
review.reviewText: Easy to find situated about 2 blocks north and two block west of the BART on Powell street, good location with lots of restaurants in the area, hotel has a bell hop and door man to keep the entrance secure, concierge was helpful, we had a nice corner room on the 3rd floor that was spacious and the bed easy comfortable, I little bit noisy with road traffic, but earplugs solved that, and the noise died down anyway

review.title: Warwick San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Great location. Easy to walk to from Bart. Easy to walk to anywhere really.
Hotel staff are knowledgable of great dining.
We had a beautiful corner room.

review.title: pleasant hotel,
review.reviewText: extremely helpful staff, convenient location, double glazing minimized traffic noise

review.title: Great time, decent accomodations in a great location
review.reviewText: Rooms are small, but well appointed. Location is excellent. If your planning to walk, bring sensible shoes!

review.title: It was convenient and comfortable.
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff, good location.

review.title: Poor Price/Quality ratio
review.reviewText:
It is quite old hotel, with not a very good conservation condition, in reference with the price they charge for the room.

The only reason to have such a high prices, should be the High season in San Francisco in August.

review.title: Will go again, for sure.
review.reviewText: Good location, reasonable priced, quiet and pleasant hotel. Will use again.

review.title: CA Coast Tourists
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. Parking was very expensive and took a long time to get the car from off-site paking. The street was noisy but the hotel itself was wonderful. The staff was so very helpful.

review.title: HOTEL
review.reviewText: Everything in this hotel smal and OLD!!!!!!

review.title: Great impressed, Great location
review.reviewText: Can't wait to go back. Great customer service.

review.title: Almost got it right
review.reviewText: already wrote it above

review.title: Marvelous hotel.
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. The location, the rooms, the lovely restaurant next door, and the price were wonderful. We had a suite which was perfect for our party.

review.title: Wonderful Experiance
review.reviewText: This Hotel is a wonderfull place. Wish we would have had more time to spend in the room it was beutiful. Perfectly located for public transportation.

review.title: Amazing service, classy hotel
review.reviewText: Around Union Sq are many boutique hotels, and almost all offer a great San Francisco experience. Compared to the ones where I've stayed, The Warwick is at the top for exceptional service and conveying that classic San Francisco feel. The 1907 building hosts the period room appointment, and is far beyond your standard hotel fare - the pictures on their web site are accurate, and are not "one off" of some suite somewhere. The hotel offers in-room WiFi and the flat panel TV. 24-hour in/out valet parking was included. The staff incredibly courteous and friendly, and housekeeping went above and beyond to recover and forward a valuable personal item I had left in the room after my one-week stay. Absolutely amazing.

review.title: Friendly hotel, would stay here again.
review.reviewText: Other than not having a key left for me as requested by my family at the front desk, we had a plesant stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was not an ice machine which was inconvenient because you had to call to have ice brought to your room. We had a suite which involved two bathrooms, a bedroom and living room. The pull out couch was not comfortable to sleep on. The bed was great. There was lots of storage space for items in the bathroom and there were large wardrobes for clothes. Hotel was quiet even though it was booked full.

review.title: Would book again
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel based on the price and location, despite some mixed reviews. I could not have been happier.

The location is excellent - easy walking distance east to Union Square and public transportation on a well-populated and busy street (good for safety concerns). Going south I felt more uncomfortable, but it was prior to businesses opening in the morning. Lots of stores and restaurants in the surrounding area.

It is an older building that has been well-renovated. I was surprised at how well the windows muffled the street noise when closed (fourth floor). I didn't mind not having air conditioning, despite being in San Francisco on one of the hottest days of the year.

I loved the antique furniture in my room, and throughout the common areas of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable.

It was a treat for me to have my luggage carried to my room by a porter, and placed on a suitcase table for my convenience. Bath towels were missing from my room when I checked in, but they were speedily delivered by the porter once I notified the front desk. Breakfast room service was delivered on time, although my main dish had been missed on the order form. It was delivered to my room in less than 10 minutes after I pointed out the error.

I was very pleased with the overall service I received. I will put the Warwick at the top of my list for any future trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Nice, smaller hotel - good location
review.reviewText: While the room was a little on the small side, everything was very nice. Nice bathroom. Nice furnishings. Had breakfast in the restaurant, which was very nice. Great location - close to Union Square.

review.title: Unbeatable location for the price.
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and comfortable - nice bed and linens - but a little dated. They have suites with seperate living rooms which is ideal when travelling with kids. You can't beat the location. It is 2 blocks from Union Square and within walking distance of Chinatown, the Embarcadero, the Financial District, Little Italy, and much more. Overall, an excellent hotel for the price. I would definitely recommend it.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: Our reservations at the hotel were incorrect however I'm not sure if that was a hotel error or an Expedia error. In any event, the hotel was conveniently located just a couple of blocks from Union Square and the cable cars. I would go there again but call in advance to ensure the reservation was correct and that we had been assigned a non-smoking room. They moved us when we made the request but I thought they should have asked us if we wanted a smoking room.

review.title: HIGHLIGHT OF MY 1ST TRIP IN USA
review.reviewText: IT WAS IN A VERY CONVENIENT LOCATION - easy to get to Union Square 1 and a half blocks away. Cable cars and trams the same. The staff were fantastic with directions and helping us to know our way around. We visited Pier 39 & Fisherman's Wharf easily. Walked the city and loved it!! Room Service was always prompt and our room lovely and clean. We ordered the large jug of coffee to the room and the way it was presented made us feel like royalty. Our last day we had checked out and they minded our luggage for us till we collected our hire car to finish visiting such a friendly and beautiful Country. When we pulled up they quickly helped us load the car as traffic was everywhere. We were sad to have had to say goodbye. Thankyou to everybody there you were wonderful.

review.title: Very charming
review.reviewText: Great location, hotel was charming and the staff was great.

review.title: The worst hotel I've ever stayed!!!!
review.reviewText:
This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in my whole life, and I'll never ever stay in Warwick San Francisco.

Seriously, it would be better to sleep on the street rather than deal with all the frustrations I encountered every day every night!!!

Just look for another one if you're visiting San Francisco.
I guarantee you can find much better one in better area (I mean downtown SF but in more safe and pleasant neighborhood) with less money.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!

review.title: Great place to stay in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This hotel was wonderful! The staff were very nice and more than accommodating for all our needs. The beds were soft and the location was perfect! We will definitely be staying here again in the future!

review.title: Convenience counts
review.reviewText: Convenience is very important when staying in a busy city like San Fransisco, and the location of the Warwick, close to public transportation, Union Square, and many restaurants, makes it ideal. Our room was rather small, which we've come to expect from "bargain-priced" accommodations, but it was clean and the toiletries provided were of good quality. However, I felt that a few amenities were lacking. Most hotels offer an in-room coffee maker or complimentary continental breakfast (or at least coffee and tea) - the Warwick offered neither, and we had to pay for coffee in the restaurant or go down the street to Starbucks. Many boutique hotels also offer a glass of complimentary wine or light snacks in the afternoon - again, the Warwick offered none of these. It would be a warm and welcoming gesture.

review.title: lousy breakfast
review.reviewText:
it's an older building, rooms are small as expected but clean,
staff is helpfull and very friendly.

restaurante is not up to par specifically breakfast. There is no fruit included in the buffet and they ran out of OJ some morning, even wheat toast.

not a place to stay with small children

review.title: Great trip to the city by the bay!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great bar in hotel and great location within San Francisco!

review.title: Could've been better- over priced & small room...
review.reviewText: The room was small & the parking was terrible. The staff was very attentive, but the surrounding neighborhood was literally scary. The surrounding restaurants were disappointing, but the "people watching" was great. The staff also was not as familiar with methods of local transportation and destinations as I would've liked to have seen. The hotel needs an updated business center as well, as it was lacking in this area.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The San Fran Warwick is a nice hotel, the room was nice, clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was also nice.

review.title: Quite comfortable
review.reviewText: This is a quaint hotel with a very friendly staff. I was greeted by name when I walked into the reception area to check in. My room was on the 7th floor and away from street noise. The antiques did not suit my taste but my room was quite comfortable. Note: they still use the old metal keys; so, make sure your door is dead-bolted when occupying the room just in case your room key was lost by a previous guest! For the price, you cannot find a better place close to Union Square. I was impressed with this hotel.

review.title: Will visit again!
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and room was nicely decorated. Very comfortable bed. Great location! Will be back in August.

review.title: Returning next month!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean and very close to everything that we wanted to do. The staff was very helpful and polite. We stayed in a Jr suite and it was beautiful! We had plenty of room. The only compaint we had was that the garbage collectors came early each morning and were quite loud in the ally right outside our window, I think that this is to be expected in the middle of the city.

review.title: A pleasant surprise in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Jr. Suite was very clean and lovely. All of the hotel staff was professional and pleasant. The bar/ restaurant is a gem and our bartender was very friendly and helpful in telling us about the area. The only negative is that because it was warm we had to sleep with the windows open and it was noisy.

review.title: Lovely San Francisco Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Wonderful and attentive staff, beautiful room, great location, and perfect little adjoining cafe - the Warwick is now my favorite San Francisco hotel and I will return often!

review.title: Great location at a great price
review.reviewText: Staff VERY friendly. 2 blocks from Union Square. Would return again.

review.title: Very nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel had a very nice old fashioned feel to it but with all the amenities of the modern world. bed was a bit hard, but would stay again especially for the price and location

review.title: Birthday Weekend
review.reviewText: Room, which was a suite, was as expected from the photos, clean, and had character. Service wasn't spectacular due to a shortage in hotel staff, but this can happen when staying in a small hotel rather than a large one. Overall, no major complaints. Just be prepared for a lot of noise from the street below, especially at night when the bars are open. Also, minibar was pretty bad, the small fridge didn't work and not much of a selection. The staff was very friendly. Great location! Food was pretty good too and I consider myself quite picky.

review.title: Great place for staying with older kids
review.reviewText: We took a Christmas trip with our 19 and 24 year olds and stayed at the Warwick for a week. The suite gave us all some privacy and needed separation at times, and the location let the kids go on their own at times with no trouble finding their way back. Get a room on a higher floor - there is street noise at times. The staff was fantastic. The location is great for getting to the cable car, Union Square, shopping, tourist areas, all very easily, by public transportation or walking. Stay toward Union Square and you'll be fine. Cost for the location and amenities was terrific. On site restaurant is great if you just want to stay "home.'

review.title: Nice Hotel and Great Deal!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a wedding and ended up choosing it based on it's better pricetag (especially through Expedia). It an historic hotel, so the rooms are a little smaller than a newer hotel, but they were really nice! The staff was super friendly and helpful, too. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: We stayed 5 days at the Warwick, I suggest you book a suit as the rooms can be rather small, but that can be expected of a older hotel. Great place to stay very central location with easy access to the muni , cable cars and shopping. Surrounded by lots of places to eat.

review.title: san fran
review.reviewText: Its a nice hotel- very close to the theatre so if you are a light sleeper do not get the suite by the main street. Great location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: great location, friendly staff, well maintained

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The big plus of this hotel its location, just off Union Square. The rooms are a bit cramped and there is very little cupboard space if there are two of you and you want to unpack your stuff rather than live out of the suitcase! Lots of restaurants and bars in the area, so don;t waste too much time in the hotel bar.

review.title: go thru the door your home
review.reviewText: cute quaint like staying at a bed and breakfast close to union square and the theater. Stay in a Jr. suite you be glad you did.

review.title: Charming hotel in a convenient location.
review.reviewText: Charming rooms. Many are junior suites. We had a standard room which was a little tight but quaintly furnished. I have actually stayed here 20 years ago when it was the Rex. Front desk, bellmen, housekeeping and restaurant staff couldn't be nicer. Breakfast is priced like a a European hotel --$10 continental and competitive with the many breakfast places on Geary St. It's a nice change from most of the business chains in this category. Right in the heart of things. Quick walk to shopping in Union Square and the cable cars. About a 10 min walk to SFMOMA. 10 minute cab ride to the Marina and Praesidio.15 min. walk to the financial district. There are many places you can walk to from the Warwick without any steep hills, which is important in San Francsisco. Not so if you stay on Nob Hill.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in great location and just a couple of blocks from the cable car line and a few blocks from chinatown. The rooms are a little small but comfortable. We had the room away from the street and it was very quiet. The room does not have AC but we did not need in early september. The only thing we were not too happy with was that the "full" breakfast did not include everything - you have a choice of either cold or hot breakfast, not both.

review.title: great ....awesome...sweet
review.reviewText: Me and a few friends were going to celebrate my 29th birthday at Ruby Skye just around the corner. This hotel was fabulous!!! LOved the feel and overall style of our room. Great deal for our money!!! We were a little giddy over the fire escape.... took lots of pictures:) Maybe all San Fran hotels have this but it was new to me and sooo awesome.... Staff was very nice and accommodating.... will definitely be back!!!

review.title: Very Satisfactory Experience
review.reviewText: We received a great deal from expedia on a vacation package and accordingly had our expectations set rather low, but we were pleasantly surprised at how enjoyable our stay was at this hotel. Our floor was quiet and we heard no noises at all from neighboring guest rooms. Our room was a deluxe queen that although was small, was more than adequate as we were barely in our room. We opened the windows at night and turned our ceiling fan on and did not miss air conditioning at all. There was some noise from outside from street level, but nothing we couldn't handle. We were on the sixth floor. My only complaint is that I thought the housekeeping could have been a little more thorough, but we were not bothered enough to express any complaints to the front desk. The location was within walking distance to all the public transporation options. We will definitely use this hotel for our next visit.

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Good proximity to union square, market st, etc. spacious rooms, decent deals, not the most glamorous, modern amenities. Classic, period piece, matches building, has SF character.

review.title: Clean, convenient and comfortable. Rooms are small.
review.reviewText: It's San Francisco after all. The usual overpriced boutique hotels. Bums and panhandlers.

review.title: Just know...
review.reviewText: Very nice little hotel in a good location near Union Plaza in the theater district, a short walk to the convention center and BART station. Just be aware that the standard rooms are VERY small, and the hotel does not have air conditioning. Sure, the weather is usually cool in San Francisco, but my room was uncomfortably stuffy.

review.title: I was impressed
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff and a great price.

review.title: Breakfast at Hotel Resturant
review.reviewText: I only have one issue, be prepared to pay alot for a little when you eat at the hotel resturant. I ordered pancakes and expected to get pancakes but what I got looked and tasted more like crapes.

review.title: A wonderful choice!
review.reviewText: The small size of this hotel, along with a very well trained staff made it feel like going home every night. We requested, and received a room on the top floor-off of Geary. There was a little bit of noise from the Hostel located in the alley-but it quieted down pretty early. When you are in the heart of the city you should expect a certain amount of noise. We heard no sounds whatsoever from within the hotel. The other guests were quiet and respectful. We found the restaurant to be very professionally staffed and the food was delicious. The front desk staff was very knowledgeable about all the public modes of transportation and helped us each morning with our plans. We loved the decor and ambience of this beautiful building. It has been said before-but this hotel is perfectly located for all of your needs. Any closer to Union Square and it might be too loud-but it was a nice quick walk. The main Powell/Market line was 5 minutes away. We would definitely choose this wonderful gem again.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Great location for a downtown visit. Close to transportation. There was a lot of street noise but otherwise a great room for the price and location.

review.title: Great hotel, good location
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly, always tried to help (extra umbrellas, directions, etc). In house restaurant, overpriced (but good). If you walk (which you should in San Francisco), be prepared for the homeless. This hotel is on the edge of a more questionable area. I always felt safe except when we walked down Taylor Street. Overall, charming and cute comfy. No AC but the windows open and the ceiling fan provided enough air to keep the room very cool. (End of February)

review.title: Noisy, small and no gym on premises
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because we needed a two room suite to accommodate both my brother and I. The good: 1. Location 2. Availability of junior suites (2 sliding doors that don't exactly close) 3. The bed was very comfortable 4. Most of the staff was very nice. The bad: 1. The gym is down the street and costs $15 per use 2. When I arrived I was given a regular room even though I paid for a junior suite. Thankfully there were junior suites so the mistake was corrected 3. You have to pay $11.95 per day for internet use 4. If you face Geary St. you're across the street from a very noisy nightclub. 5. The rooms are very, very small 6. The tv in the living room did not work and the staff did not send the repairman as promised. I had to remind them and then I had a repairman in my room for 2-3 hours.

review.title: Did not enjoy stay
review.reviewText: No Air Condition in room, hall way was cooler than room. Small room. Outside noise very distracting. Staff very friendy and helpful. Food from room service bad. Would not recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This is an older, charming, historic hotel near downtown with a great location, across from the theatres and a few blocks from Union Square shopping, Museum of Modern Art, and cable car stops. My husband and our two daughters shared the largest suite at the Warwick, and while not as luxurious as newer, more spendy SF hotels, this was perfect for a long weekend getaway - two large separate rooms, two bathrooms, and two TVs. It was right in the middle of everything, and we really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a PC with free Internet access in the lobby (or room WiFi for a fee). The hotel restaurant food was great, and there are plenty of other good restaurants nearby too. Lots to see and do in this area. The down side: aggressive panhandlers sometimes made for an uneasy walk. Sadly, just part of the SF downtown scene.

review.title: Excellent SF Choice
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is perfect and the price is right. I looked at several other hotels before booking - most were more expensive - it looked like they were all near each other but I was surprised to walk past all of them. We stayed in a junior suite because we were there for three nights and just in case we ended up spending more time in the room than planned due to weather, we didn't want to feel too cramped. The restaurant is excellent and wonderfully convenient for breakfast.

review.title: Satisfying Experience
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I recently spent a week in San Fran, and the Warwick was in a great location near Union Square and the Powell Street bus/cable car/train station. It was very easy for us to walk to the Powell Street station and use the public transportation to get anywhere in the city. The price was good for what we received at the hotel. The room and bathroom were very clean, and the staff was helpful and friendly. The only drawbacks of the hotel were the decor in the rooms and the thinness of the walls and ceiling. At night and in the morning, we could hear the guests above our floor walking in their room, and on our last night guests moved into the neighboring room and we could hear their t.v. through the walls. We also got woken up by the garbage trucks every morning. We were staying on the 4th floor. We never ate at the hotel's restaurant because it was too pricey. It was a good experience, and we would stay at the hotel again.

review.title: Junior suite was nice
review.reviewText: this hotel has lots of potenial to be a wonderful best kept secret. The lobby was small but nicely appointed. the staff was friendly, helpful, and kind. The Junior Suite was nice, but it could have been wonderful if there were cealing fans installed so that it is not nessecary to open windows as the alley is noicey and our room faced the Youth Hostel across the alley and they party til 4am!(every nite we were there)

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!!
review.reviewText: The staff was so professional and accomodating. We had a beautiful suite on the top floor that was delightful. The staff helped us to find a great restaurant in China Town and wrote directions. We loved the location. My girl's and I are already talking about planning another trip for shopping.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: The Warwick was clean and professional. We had two problems. First we were on the second floor with windows on an alleyway. It got a bit noisy when the bars closed around 2 am. I had to ask two different groups of people to get away from my window. Both mornings there was a trash pick-up around 6:00 am. If you ever stay here, ask for a room on one of the higher floors. Second, we asked for breakfast room service at 8:00 am the night before. We received a call at 6:50 am that morning informing us they were out of milk and what would we like instead. They woke us up. Somewhat minor but annoying none the less.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: No air conditioning and when you opened a window the outside noise was so bad you could not sleep.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location for everything: Sightseeing, shopping, buses, restaurants, etc. We had a Jr suite for the four of us - 2 bathrooms and a sliding door between the 2 rooms. Perfect for the older kids- we were all together but had some privacy too.

review.title: Great time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Will happily stay at the Warwick again. Was a little concerned knowing that it was near the Tenderloin District, but we felt safe the entire time. Most annoying part was all the aggressive homeless people...we were approached 12 times during a five block walk to Market street cable cars. San Fran really needs to clean that mess up! Warwick was in a great central location - within walking distance of cable cables and old F-Line to get to the wharf. It's also just around the corner from a Hertz rental so we had everything we needed. Was being renovated while we were there but it wasn't too bad. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Stayed a full week and would happily do it again!!!

review.title: New York style hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Room was on the small side, but nicely decorated with quality materials. Room faced building like in New York but wasn't too bad. Location is more Tenderloin than Union Square so one had to walk up and down Mason not Taylor to avoid "sketchy" sections. Very close to Union Square for Non-Union Square prices.

review.title: Sweet stay at the Warwick
review.reviewText: Great location and accesible to all of the major attractions. Great deli two doors down. Very friendly amd pleasant staff. It's gonna be my signature for San Francisco

review.title: Comfortable and Clean Great Location Average Service
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location near the ACT Theater and the rooms are comfortable and clean. Was disappointed in the time it took to retrieve my car from the valet (over 30 minutes) and also that the staff all went outside when there was a fire on the scaffolding leaving clients on their own when calling the front desk. Service was adequate but not above and beyond.

review.title: great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: only a block to union square and all the shops and at a great price the Warwick has all you need from a hotel without being over priced. comfort and a bit of style without being too posh. great customer service - they ordered a taxi (more like a limo!) for us to the airport for only $45

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great hotel! Right up the street from central shopping area. Only negative is no air conditioning but you can open the windows.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel - excellent location, friendly staff, beautifully decorated room. We're very happy with this hotel.

review.title: Wondercon
review.reviewText: My 16 yr old & I spent 4 nights & 3 days for the Wondercon convention. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. The room was a suite with a queen bed and a comfortable hide away sofa bed. We were on the 2nd floor and it was not too noisy in the alley below until about 6:30 AM. Walgreens was right next door and Jack in the Box was a block away as was a nice bakery. We walked almost one mile each way to the Moscone Center. This was a great hotel at a great price. They let me use internet each day for 10 minutes as I had no laptop with me.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I would strongly recommend the Warwick Regis to anyone going to San Francisco. The location is superb and the rooms and staff are excellent and very helpful.

review.title: great location and have stayed several times
review.reviewText: charming boutique hotel in theater district and near great restaurants and reasonably priced, very accommodating staff

review.title: carming and full of character. would highly recommend.
review.reviewText: The Warwick is charming and full of character. If you don't mind the city noise, you are in the perfect location. Located right next to union spare. Would highly recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Quaint, comfortable small hotel
review.reviewText: I visited San Francisco on a four-day business trip and stayed at the Warwick Regis when our nearby conference hotel was sold out and other hotels in the vicinity were priced outside our departmental budget. My room was just what I needed: A comfortable centrally located place to stay while attending the conference and making the occasional touristy side trip. My room was small but tidy and perfectly adequate for one or two people. The building is a a classic San Francisco vintage Victorian that could probably use a bit of decorative updating, though the dining room/bar was quite lovely. It's on the edge of the Tenderloin district, however, so be wary about venturing west, especially at night. To the east, however, are all the trendy Union Square shops and department stores.

review.title: A quaint boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Would jighly recommend this very nice hotel. Right downtown with access to just about everything.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Good location to Union Square, major shopping, and Cable Cars. Staff was courteous and housekeeping provided us with any requests. We requested a non-smoking room, but when we arrived we were offered a smoking room that was larger than what we were originally going to be assigned. It didn't smell like smoke and actually turned out to be nice. Be aware that there are very small rooms that do not face the street and don't have a view. I believe that if they're booked full and you book through the internet and not directly through the Warwick, you're probably going to get the smallest, least desirable room. I would definitely stay there again, but would only do so if I was quaranteed a room facing the street.

review.title: Warwick is Wonderful
review.reviewText: The Warwick is a wonderful little hotel. The rooms are not grand, but they are clean and tidy. If you need accessible and flexible high-speed Internet, find another hotel. But if you are OK with a European style hotel, then this place is for you. It does not have central air conditioning--which is not usually an issue, but can be. The staff is like family. They are very helpful and always curteous. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel but it is really a dinner restaurant. The best breakfast in town is down the street a block. The Curran and ACT Theaters are across the street. A dozen great restaurants are within a 3 block walk. So, the location cannot be beat.

review.title: Very Uncomfortable
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel looking for some good rest. It was our Anniversary and first night away from our new baby. The room was small and was right next to a very old and noisy elevator. The bed was hard, the linens stiff, it had an old scratchy comforter and flat smelly pillows! Staff was just OK. Don't stay here if you are looking for a good night's sleep. Location was good.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Will recommend to friends

review.title: No thanks
review.reviewText: I would not stay here again. The room was very small, it did not have a coffee maker and the alarm clock did not work. There was an extra charge for everything, including internet service. It did not seem to have a cooling capacity except the ceiling fan. The front desk staff were friendly and polite, but did not offer help.

review.title: Would highly recommend
review.reviewText: My daughter and I were upgraded to the Junior Suite - what a nice surprise. Room was beautiful, staff was wonderful. Great location, as well. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Poor Service, base accomodations
review.reviewText: This is a moderate hotel with very poor service (no consierge) and in desperate need of new FF&E. For example, the carpet in the elevator was literally disgusting. I needed a private room and sitting area for my daughter to sleep, so it fit the bill, but if I were traveling alone or with my wife, I'd pass on this one

review.title: Great service, small room.
review.reviewText: I really liked this hotel. It is perfectly located near union Square near the theatres, shopping and dining. The sevice was great and the rooms nicely appointed. My room was, however, extremely small and the bed was satisfactory but could have been more comfortable.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice and well situated just two blocks from Union Square and the cable cars. The room was a lttle smaller then expected but still comfortable.

review.title: Excellent Stay
review.reviewText: wonderful location and staff, beautiful room, and the water turns warm instantly, a very nice luxury. Eat at 24 hr Mason's Grill for tasty California food. For the best food and superior service we loved Kuletos on Powell st for dinner. Kuletos has the best scallops I have ever eaten.

review.title: worst hotel experience we've ever had
review.reviewText: first the hotel had no air conditioning, so don't stay in the summer it can get hot in San francisco. The room was so tiny one person had to stand in the bathroom so the other could get around the bed. our room was located on an alley that apparently has a Hostel and there was loud talking and other things going on all night, no sleep. The TV was 12". What hotel has a 12" TV? We were supposed to stay 2 nights but went to another hotel the second night.

review.title: Noisy, but not bad.
review.reviewText: The overall stay in this hotel was nice, the only things we did not like was the size of the bathroom/bathtub(too small) and the fact that the hotel is older so there is not much insulation, thus all we heard all night long were sirens from the fire engines since it is not far from the fire station. The bed was very nice and comfortable, the room was cleaned and we got fresh, clean towels every day even though we did not request them. The decor in the rooms was very nice/romantic. It was our honeymoon so I did not want your ordinary hotel room. The hotel staff for them most part was very friendly, but we did not interact with them very much. Overall we had a good stay.

review.title: A bit expensive
review.reviewText: Our room was beautiful and pretty comfortable. We were promised a balcony which we did not get and the "afternoon tea and cookies" was a tiny cart in the tiny lobby with some chips ahoy under glass and some coffee and tea pots-Within walking distance to lots of places, short walk to Union Square

review.title: Nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed, nice bathroom, elegent lobby. I would go back. Also a great value for the area.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay!
review.reviewText: Charming, clean and great location! Will go out of my way to stay here again. Finally a hotel that exceeded my expectations. Staff were friendly and helpful but still professional. My business partner is a smoker but my room on the smoking floor was fresh and clean! Probably the best value hotel I've stayed in in the states or in europe. We ate at the resaurant for breakfast and dinner and it was as good as most in the area.

review.title: Terrific hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText: Checked in by helpful, cheerful staff and found our room to look exactly as pictured. It was clean and well cared for. Walked just a few short blocks to Union Square and took a cab to dinner in North Beach and back. Returned to the hotel in the evening to find our sheets turned down with a chocolate. Robes were another surprise for the price. Outstanding deal!

review.title: I will return to the Warwick!
review.reviewText: This is not a BIG hotel but is very comfortable. With great early 1900's architecture, you can feel the history. The rooms have all the modern features including HD TV, in room safes, internet access, etc. We ate in the hotel restuarant/bar. The food and drink were wonderful. The location is downtown in the theater district, so there is much to see and do all within walking distance. There is no parking so you must valet, but the charge is reasonable considering the downtown location

review.title: Nice hotel for the deal we received.
review.reviewText: Good location, nice/friendly....rooms a little small (twin beds), but beautifully appointed. Would defintely return.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised -
review.reviewText: Very clean, very pleasant and helpful staff. Junior suite can sleep 3 adults or 2 adults and 2 small children, door separates the rooms. Some loud noise at night from street below. Near Union Sq.

review.title: A Small Gem
review.reviewText: Stayed two nights during the week between Christmas and New Years. We stayed in a Junior Suite, and it was very comfortable, very clean, and well appointed. In addition, the staff was very friendly and helpful. In the past, we have always stayed in the larger hotels when in San Francisco. But no more! For the price, quality of accomodations, and the location, it is a wonderful hotel!

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the Warwick. Very cute room- but small. What you would expect in a large city. Price was very good- especially in comparison to the other hotels in the area of equal quality. Only thing i would change- I wish they had a fitness center.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed the Warwick Regis. It was convenient, the rooms pleasant and the staff was very helpful. I would definietely stay there again and the Junior Suite is the way to go as it provides more room at not alot more per night than the standard room which can be on the small side. The location was great! They can book you a towncar for the airport- in either direction which is a deal. the only thing that I would have appreciated since the rooms do not have coffee makers is coffee available in the morning.

review.title: Great Location , Great Price
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 nights at the hotel couple blocks from Union Square. The staff was great, professional and very friendly...the hotel is charming, a little "Old charm" but the room are super clean and well appointed. The location is great... My best friend was turning 40 and the staff did all they could to make us welcome. I would come back to this hotel!

review.title: A good hotel for the price because of location
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful. The hotel could use some renovation. I was put on a smoking floor with an air scrubber in my room. That was disappointing because my suitcase and clothes had a strange odor. Fair place to stay for the price if you want to stay downtown. If want to have a nice San Fran vacation, spend a little more money and stay somewhere a little nicer. San Fran has a lot to offer.

review.title: Cute and comfortable
review.reviewText: The Warwick Regis is like an antique piece of furniture. It's a little worn but has beautiful details, such as the carvings over the doorways and armoires in the rooms instead of closets. The service was great and you can't beat the location near all the shops and theatres downtown.

review.title: Very Happy With Everything
review.reviewText: Just spent a short vaction in SFO. Hotel was clean and convient, staff was friendly and helpful. Felt safe in area even after dark. And the showers had good pressure for those who care about those things.

review.title: Older Hotel Charm
review.reviewText: The Warwick Regis brings back the charm of an Older Hotel. The Hotel Staff caters to your evey need and were welcoming and friendly. The room, although small in comparison to newer hotels, was very comfortable and well appointed. Although located along Geary Ave. the hotel was quite. Excellent location for theatre, restaurants and shopping (Antiques and High End Department Stores) Hotel of choice and high value for the dollar.

review.title: Boutique - small, good quality, lacks some amenities
review.reviewText: The Regis is a boutique hotel which is an euphemism for an older, smaller hotel. The decor is nice in sort of a retro way. Unfortunately, the hotel's amenities are sort of retro - no broadband (Wi-Fi available for an extra fee) and no in-room coffee. The service was very good. I made two special requests and both were handled quickly with courtesy.

review.title: Just right
review.reviewText: This is an understated hotel: easy to get to, easy to stay at, professionally run; entirely satisfactory on all fronts. Recommended.

review.title: Very pleased
review.reviewText: Room was very pleasant and the service was outstanding.  Good location.

review.title: The best place to stay in the city
review.reviewText: Very comfortable, elegant, relaxing with a great staff and client service.

review.title: Peace During the Strike
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The picture on the internet actually looked like the room (that is not always the case). Everything was luxurious, but the best part was that the hotel was small enough that it was not being picketed by the the hotel strickers that were marching and yelling on bull horns 24 hours a day.

review.title: great value lodging
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, conveniently located. bath small but well-equipped and extremely clean
